0.title: Shivling claim unfair: AIMPLB on Gyanvapi Mosque case
0.article_body: Following claims of a Shivling being found in Varanasi’s Gyanvapi Mosque complex were reported, the All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) termed it as "unfair". "The attempt to declare it (mosque) a temple is nothing more than a conspiracy to create communal disharmony. It’s a matter of constitutional rights and is against the law," AIMPLB said in a statement.

1.title: Woman's family beats, parades man naked for 'texting her' in K'taka
1.article_body: A 20-year-old man was allegedly held captive, beaten and paraded naked in a village in Karnataka's Davanagere by a woman's family and some locals for "texting her", police said on Monday. This comes after purported videos of the incident, which occurred last week, surfaced online. The man's mother claimed in her complaint that he was held captive for two days.

2.title: Rupee hits new all-time low, slips to 77.73 against US dollar
2.article_body: The Indian rupee has touched a fresh all-time low of 77.73 against the US dollar as oil prices surged to near highest level in almost eight weeks. The rupee had ended at 77.45/dollar on Friday. Indian share markets are trading slightly higher with all eyes on the listing of state-run Life Insurance Corporation, the country's biggest IPO.

3.title: Daughter asked 'Mummy, is it cancer?', started crying: Chhavi on breast cancer
3.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal, who recently underwent surgery after being diagnosed with breast cancer, said that she told her daughter that she is "very unwell" and she is going to fix the problem. "She knows about cancer as I had lost my nani to esophageal cancer...She turned around and said, 'Mummy, is it that?' I said, 'Yes'...she started crying," Chhavi added.

4.title: DC's total was definitely chaseable for the batting we have: Mayank
4.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal said they lost "too many" wickets in the first 10 overs and that's why they lost their game against DC. "It was definitely chaseable for the batting we have and the wicket wasn't as bad as it seemed," he added. DC posted 159/7 and restricted PBKS to 142/9 to win their seventh game of IPL 2022.

5.title: Delhi man jailed for demolishing neighbour's wall using excavator
5.article_body: A man has been sentenced to 45 days imprisonment by Delhi High Court after he demolished his neighbour's boundary wall using a JCB excavator in violation of a court order. The incident occurred in Delhi's Burari over a property dispute. Holding him guilty of contempt and rejecting his apology, the court said the demolition was a wilful and deliberate act.

6.title: Biden reverses Trump's withdrawal of US troops from Somalia
6.article_body: US President Joe Biden has approved the redeployment of US troops in Somalia, reversing a decision by his predecessor Donald Trump. The deployment was requested by US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin to "enable a more effective fight against al-Shabaab". The Pentagon said the troops wouldn't be directly fighting in combat operations, but working to train, advise and equip Somali forces.

7.title: Gyanvapi mosque survey report not ready yet, will seek 3-4 days from court: Official
7.article_body: The Gyanvapi mosque survey report is not complete yet and is only 50% ready, Assistant Court Commissioner Ajay Pratap Singh said on Tuesday. "We will not be able to produce the report before the court today. We will seek three-four days' time from Varanasi court," he added. "The survey lasted for three days from May 14-16," Singh further said.

8.title: WB Guv seeks report over police 'trespass' at BJP MLA's office
8.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar has sought a response from the state Chief Secretary over the alleged "criminal trespass" of state police and RAF at BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari's office-cum-residence in Nandigram. Adhikari had shared videos of the incident on May 15, claiming that the "'Mamata' police had barged" in without any prior intimation. Dhankhar called the incident "worrisome".

9.title: Passengers travelling in Mumbai AC locals increase by 4 times from Feb to May
9.article_body: The number of passengers travelling by AC locals in Mumbai has increased from a daily average of 5,939 in February to 26,815 in May till date. "The response to AC locals upped after the slashing of single journey ticket rates by 50% from May 5," a railway official said. CSMT, Dombivli are top two stations in terms of ticket sale.

10.title: Was at badminton court while growing up, there was no time for movies: Deepika
10.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone said that her "growing up life" was very different from her friends from the industry. "I was at the badminton court and it was a very structured and disciplined life, in that sense. There was no time for movies," Deepika said, adding that she would watch only one or two movies in a year.

11.title: Telangana minister KTR slams PM Modi over his promise for ‘Achhe Din’
11.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao slammed Prime Minister Narendra Modi for not living up to his promise of 'Achhe Din' and said, "8 years ago...you had promised Achhe Din." "What your government has delivered - rupee at its lowest, highest unemployment in 45 years, highest inflation in 30 years, highest LPG price in...world, worst economy in 42 years," he added.

12.title: Would do anything to see you again: Ananya on grandmother's birth anniversary
12.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday took to her Instagram Stories to remember her late grandmother, Snehlata Panday, on her birth anniversary. Sharing an old picture of herself with her grandmother,  Ananya wrote, "Happy Birthday Dadi. I love and miss you so much. I would do anything to see you again." Ananya's grandmother passed away last year on July 10.

13.title: 'Gabbar Singh' director Harish working on a script for Salman: Report
13.article_body: Harish Shankar, director of films like 'Gabbar Singh' and 'Ramayya Vasthavayya', is reportedly writing a script for Salman Khan. "[He'll] discuss and pitch to him at the right time, in a right way when everything is finalised...Something big and interesting is on cards," the report said while quoting a source. Meanwhile, Salman is currently working on 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'.

14.title: Hit by wheat export ban, Madhya Pradesh traders call mandi strike
14.article_body: Affected by the ban on wheat export, the traders' associations in Madhya Pradesh have called for a two-day bandh of mandis during which they will not participate in auctioning process of wheat. A traders' association said the ban has badly hit them as around 4,000 trucks from the state are stuck outside Kandla and Mumbai ports for 10 days.

15.title: LIC shares get listed on stock exchanges, trade at ₹872 in pre-open trade
15.article_body: India's largest insurer Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) listed its shares on the stock exchanges on Tuesday. In pre-open, the shares settled at ₹872 per share on NSE against its issue price of ₹949 apiece. The ₹20,557-crore IPO had closed on May 9. The LIC IPO was India's largest to date and had closed with nearly 3 times subscriptions.

16.title: Mehmood & Mithun's portrayal in films were strange, look odd today: Siddharth
16.article_body: Actor Siddharth spoke about the way non-Hindi speaking characters were shown as "caricatures" in Hindi cinema. He said, "From the age of comedians, [we had] actors like Mehmood who made unrealistic and strange portrayals which were very popular at that time. But today, you feel odd watching them." "There was Mithun Chakraborty playing...Krishnan Iyer and selling coconut water," he added.

17.title: 35-yr-old man held for 'forcefully' marrying minor cousin in Telangana
17.article_body: A 35-year-old man was arrested in Telangana’s Ranga Reddy for "forcefully" marrying his 12-year-old cousin, police said. The minor girl was rescued and her parents’ role is being probed as they allegedly misled her into the marriage on the pretext of attending a family function, according to the police. The minor girl lodged a police complaint, a police official said.

18.title: CBI conducts searches at multiple locations of Congress leader Karti Chidambaram
18.article_body: The CBI is conducting searches at multiple locations of Congress leader Karti Chidambaram in connection with an ongoing case, his office told news agency ANI. The searches are reportedly being conducted at around seven premises. In March, a Delhi court granted regular bail to Karti and his father P Chidambaram in Aircel-Maxis cases filed by CBI and ED.

19.title: Deepika Padukone attends jury dinner at Cannes 2022, pics surface
19.article_body: Deepika Padukone, who's a part of the main jury at the Cannes Film Festival 2022, joined the other jury members for dinner at the Grand Hyatt Cannes Hotel Martinez on Monday evening. She attended the dinner along with actress-filmmaker Rebecca Hall as well as directors Asghar Farhadi and Joachim Trier. Several pictures of Deepika from the event have surfaced online.

20.title: Woman judge killed, 3 others injured as car collides with jeep in Raj
20.article_body: A woman judge, Saroj Chaudhary, died and three others were injured after her car collided head-on with Irrigation Department Assistant Engineer Shankar Lal's jeep on Bikaner-Khajuwala highway in Rajasthan. Reports said that Saroj, who was in the back seat of the car, was bleeding profusely when she was taken to the hospital. The doctors then declared her dead.

21.title: Sharjeel Imam moves HC seeking bail after SC puts sedition on hold
21.article_body: JNU student leader Sharjeel Imam has moved Delhi High Court seeking bail after the Supreme Court recently ordered the sedition law to be put on hold. Imam has been booked under IPC Section 124A for allegedly giving inflammatory speeches during the anti-CAA protests. A two-judge bench is scheduled to hear the plea on May 17.

22.title: Pant shouldn't have fallen into PBKS' trap: RP Singh
22.article_body: Ex-India cricketer RP Singh has criticised DC captain Rishabh Pant for his batting approach during their match against PBKS. "Pant shouldn't have fallen into the trap...He had hit a six, another big shot was not needed...The team management also has to think about how Pant has to approach his innings," stated Singh. Pant was dismissed after scoring 7(3).

23.title: We're all commie as f***: Twitter's senior engineer in a leaked recording
23.article_body: In a leaked video recording, a senior engineer at Twitter was heard saying, "We're all commie as f***" while speaking in reference to how differently the company functions from Tesla CEO Elon Musk's firms. Siru Murugesan said, "He's a capitalist and we weren't really operating as capitalists, more like very socialist." He claimed employees tried to revolt against Musk's takeover.

24.title: Hyderabad Police arrests 8 for selling plots using fake documents
24.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Sunday arrested eight people for allegedly forging documents and selling plots illegally. The case came to light after the complainant informed the police that the accused had forged property documents in the name of her husband who was dead. The accused persons then transferred the property to themselves and sold it for ₹6 crore, police said.

25.title: Kourtney Kardashian shares pics from her intimate wedding to Travis Barker
25.article_body: American media personality Kourtney Kardashian took to Instagram to confirm getting married to musician Travis Barker. Sharing pictures from their intimate wedding, Kourtney wrote, "Till death do us part." Commenting on her post, Kim Kardashian wrote, "Kravis forever." The duo had got engaged in October 2021 after having made their relationship official on Instagram in February last year.

26.title: India reports 1,569 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 16,400
26.article_body: India has reported 1,569 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,202 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 16,400, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,260, according to the latest data.

27.title: It was Kohli's chance to win IPL, bowling that 1 over shattered me: Watson on 2016 final
27.article_body: Talking about the IPL 2016 final, wherein he conceded 24 runs off SRH's last over, Shane Watson said, "Bowling that one over just shattered me." He added, "RCB had played so well all year...Kohli, in particular, was on fire. It was his chance, one of the greatest players, to win that elusive IPL title as captain."

28.title: Ukraine evacuates troops from last holdout in besieged Mariupol city
28.article_body: More than 260 Ukrainian soldiers were evacuated from Mariupol's Azovstal steelworks, Ukraine's last stronghold in the port city, after weeks of resistance against the Russian invasion. All the evacuees, including 53 badly wounded troops, were taken to areas under Russia’s control. They will be subject to a potential prisoner exchange with Russia, Ukraine's Deputy Defence Minister Anna Malyar said.

29.title: Curfew in MP's Neemuch over clashes after Lord Hanuman idol placed near dargah
29.article_body: Clashes broke out between two communities on Monday after some people placed an idol of Lord Hanuman near a dargah in the old Kachari area in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch, police said. The district administration imposed prohibitory orders under section 144 following the clashes. "During the clashes, some persons pelted stones damaging three-four motorcycles but no persons were injured," police added.

30.title: Twitter doesn't believe in free speech: Senior engineer in leaked recording
30.article_body: A senior engineer at Twitter has said the company "doesn't believe in free speech" and the employees "hated" Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s $44 billion takeover bid. An American activist group Project Veritas released a recording of Siru Murugesan's remarks. Murugesan said Twitter's office politics were quite left-leaning and the staff had to change their original views to adjust to it.

31.title: The only process was to take it deep: Pant on 17-run win vs PBKS
31.article_body: After DC defeated PBKS to register their second straight win, captain Rishabh Pant said he wanted to change the pattern of "losing one and winning one game". Talking about the match, Pant said, "The only process was to take it deep, with spinners getting help." He added, "[We'll] assess the wicket and see how [the next game] goes."

32.title: 21-yr-old man held for making derogatory video against Hindu deities in UP
32.article_body: A 21-year-old man was arrested for making a video in which he allegedly made derogatory remarks against Hindu deities, police said. The accused man, Umar Abdullah, purportedly posted an "inappropriate" video on social media. The incident was reported on May 14 and the accused was arrested on Monday after the police were tipped off about his presence in his locality.

33.title: Bengaluru reports less than 100 COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 1.05%
33.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday reported 89 new COVID-19 cases, as compared to 118 new cases reported on Sunday. According to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), zero deaths were reported in the last 24 hours, while 131 people recovered from the virus during the same period. The positivity rate in the city now stands at 1.05%, the data showed.

34.title: 40-yr-old illegal market demolished in Mohali by GMADA, 4 acres freed
34.article_body: The Greater Mohali Area Development Authority (GMADA) on Monday carried out a demolition drive at the 40-year-old Shaheed Bhagat Singh Market in Phase-1, reclaiming around four acres of government land. Around 50 illegal temporary shops had come up at the market, officials said. The shopkeepers raised slogans to protest against the drive that continued from 12 pm to 3:30 pm.

35.title: Despite raid at dad's house, Madhuri shot for comedy scene: Rajkumar Santoshi
35.article_body: Filmmaker Rajkumar Santoshi said that once when he was shooting with actress Madhuri Dixit in Ooty, she shot for a comedy scene despite her father's house being raided in Mumbai at the same time. "She didn't let the director know...she was under stress and had to reach Mumbai...didn't let the director know...there was stress in her personal life," Santoshi added.

36.title: IISc B'lore develops tooth-cleaning nanobots for dental treatment
36.article_body: Researchers at Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bangalore have developed nano-sized robots that can kill bacteria deep inside dentinal tubules and improve the success rate of root canal treatments. According to researchers, the existing techniques aren't efficient enough to go deep and kill the bacteria. They said the new technique allows nanobots to penetrate deep and clean the infection.

37.title: Over 100 Ghaziabad high-rises lack firefighting systems: Officials
37.article_body: Officials of Ghaziabad district's fire department said that they have inspected 113 residential high-rise buildings which lacked firefighting measures and have failed to adhere to fire safety norms. As per official records, Ghaziabad witnessed 3,177 fire incidents from January 2019 to March 2022. "We checked about 202 hospitals and only 42 of them had firefighting systems," an official said.

38.title: Thought I shouldn't be destroying what Rishi had done: Paresh on 'Sharmaji...'
38.article_body: Paresh Rawal spoke about the challenge of completing late actor Rishi Kapoor's 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. He said, "The challenge for me was what Rishi saab had done, I shouldn't be destroying that. Whatever he has sawed, without vandalising that, I need to carry it forward in a subtle way." "It was a relay race that I had to complete," he added.

39.title: BBMP identifies 9,500 potholes to fix in Bengaluru
39.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has identified around 9,500 potholes in Bengaluru which it said will be fixed in a continuous exercise. "This is not the final number as the procedure has just been started and the data is only two to three days old," BBMP official said. The civic body will use FixMyStreet app to identify more potholes.

40.title: 20-yr-old woman raped at knifepoint in Mumbai, video filmed; 2 arrested
40.article_body: Police have arrested two brothers for allegedly raping a 20-year-old woman at knifepoint in Mumbai. Reports said that while one of them raped her, other filmed video and threatened to circulate it if she spoke about incident to anyone. Police said that accused entered her house in broad daylight and raped woman who had come to Mumbai two months ago.

41.title: 18-yr-old girl gives birth in Pune; parents booked for marrying her as minor
41.article_body: After an 18-year-old girl gave birth to a baby at Pune's Sassoon General Hospital recently, a case has been filed against her parents, husband, father-in-law and mother-in-law for allegedly getting her married when she was a minor. A police sub-inspector said that the girl had turned 18 this year in February. "No arrest has been made yet," the sub-inspector added.

42.title: upGrad launches Doctorate programs from global universities
42.article_body: upGrad has partnered with Golden Gate University, San Francisco and Swiss School of Business & Management, Geneva to offer Online DBA Programs for working professionals. Professionals with 5+ years of experience can now add a Doctor's title to their list of achievements by pursuing a thesis in their area of expertise, with 1:1 supervision from international faculty in 3 years.

43.title: 16-year-old boy killed as tempo hits two-wheeler in Pune
43.article_body: A 16-year-old boy was killed after a tempo first hit a hoarding, then rammed into a shed built in front of a butcher shop and then hit two two-wheeler vehicles in Pune's Dhankawadi, police said. The deceased teenager was sitting on one of the two two-wheelers, police added. The driver was driving the tempo without a permit, police further said.

44.title: Greek man gets life sentence for killing British wife in front of kid
44.article_body: A Greek pilot was sentenced to life in prison for killing his 20-year-old wife in front of their 11-month-old child last year. Babis Anagnostopoulos had initially claimed that thieves broke into their house and killed his wife and dog. Following evidence from CCTV cameras at their home and a smartwatch worn by his wife, the 34-year-old confessed to the murder.

45.title: Johnny Depp slapped me, squeezed my neck against railway car during honeymoon: Heard
45.article_body: While testifying in her ex-husband Johnny Depp's defamation trial against her, actress Amber Heard claimed that Depp hit her during their honeymoon. "Johnny slapped me across the face...He squeezed my neck against the railway car for what felt like a very long time." She added, "At some point he ripped his shirt off, and wrapped it around my neck."

46.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read as DC enter top 4?
46.article_body: With their 17-run victory over PBKS, DC moved to the fourth position on the IPL 2022 points table. DC are fourth with 14 points and a net run-rate (NRR) of 0.255. Meanwhile, RCB are now fifth on the points table with 14 points and NRR of -0.323. KKR and PBKS are sixth and seventh, respectively.

47.title: T'gana owes GHMC ₹5,500 crore in property taxes as of April: Report
47.article_body: Telangana government and its undertakings owe Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation  (GHMC) over ₹5,500 crore in property taxes as of April, The Indian Express reported, citing an RTI response. In response to the RTI, the GHMC commissioner reportedly said that they've been regularly issuing notices for the payments. Some of the taxes have been pending for 25 years, the report said.

48.title: 5 feared drowned in Yamuna while escaping attack by rival group in Haryana
48.article_body: At least five men were feared drowned in Yamuna while escaping an attack by nearly 20 men of a rival group in Haryana's Yamunanagar, police said. They reportedly jumped into the water to save their lives. An NDRF team on Monday recovered three bodies. "The incident is said to be a fallout of multiple clashes between the groups," police added.

49.title: Twitter deal at a lower price is not out of the question, says Musk
49.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that the Twitter acquisition deal being viable at a lower cost is "not out of the question". Speaking at a conference, Musk said, "You can't pay the same price for something that is much worse than they claimed." He also said, "The more questions I ask, the more my concerns grow."

50.title: 207 bodies lying unclaimed in 10 Mumbai mortuaries since Feb 2021: Report
50.article_body: At least 207 bodies have been lying unclaimed in 10 mortuaries of civic and police surgeon-run hospitals across Mumbai since February 2021, a report said. According to the police manual, unclaimed bodies should be disposed within seven to 30 days. Officials said the unclaimed bodies that are usually of the victims of railway or road accidents are rarely identified.

51.title: Elisabeth Borne to become France's 1st female Prime Minister in 30 years
51.article_body: France's President Emmanuel Macron has appointed Labour Minister Elisabeth Borne as the country's new PM, the first woman to hold the position in three decades. This comes after Prime Minister Jean Castex submitted his resignation. During Borne's tenure as Labour Minister, unemployment fell to its lowest level in 15 years and youth unemployment to its lowest level in 40 years.

52.title: We suspend over half a million spam accounts every day: Twitter CEO
52.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal shared an extensive Twitter thread on spam accounts amid its acquisition deal with Tesla CEO Elon Musk being put on hold. Parag tweeted, "We suspend over half a million spam accounts every day, usually before any of you even see them on Twitter. We...lock millions of accounts each week that we suspect may be spam."

53.title: Twitter CEO posts long thread on spam accounts, Musk replies with poop emoji
53.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal on Monday tweeted a long thread on spam accounts amid Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s proposed acquisition being put on hold over fake accounts data. Speaking about Musk’s plan to identify bots, Parag said “We don't believe that this specific estimation can be performed externally”. In reply to this, Musk tweeted a poop emoji.

54.title: Mumbai auto unions to protest on May 17 demanding CNG price reduction
54.article_body: Auto-rickshaw unions in Mumbai will go on a day-long protest outside Mahanagar Gas Limited office in Bandra Kurla Complex on May 17 demanding a reduction in CNG prices. Auto-rickshaw unions are also demanding a ₹2 hike in base fare. "We expect around 5,000 drivers to turn up for the protest," said Mumbai Auto Rickshaw Taximen's Union President Shashank Rao.

55.title: 2 Mumbai homebuyers to get 7 times the price of undelivered flats
55.article_body: About 27 years after they booked flats in City Builders' City Embassy project in Kopar Khairane in Navi Mumbai, Gul Achra and Kanta Achra will receive ₹91 lakh and ₹88 lakh respectively as the builder failed to complete the project. While Gul had booked a flat worth ₹12.56 lakh in November 1995, Kanta had booked another flat for ₹13.16 lakh.

56.title: DC defeat PBKS by 17 runs, move to 4th position on IPL 2022 points table
56.article_body: DC defeated PBKS by 17 runs at the DY Patil Stadium in Mumbai to move to the fourth position on the IPL 2022 points table. DC and RCB now have 14 points each, with DC having a superior net run-rate (NRR). Mitchell Marsh top-scored for DC with 63(48), while DC fast bowler Shardul Thakur took four wickets in the match.

57.title: He has some superpowers, is GOAT in tennis right now: Swiatek on Nadal
57.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek praised Rafael Nadal, saying he's the "perfect role model" and the "Greatest of All Time" (GOAT) in tennis right now. Recalling Nadal's 2022 Australian Open victory when he came back from two sets down against Daniil Medvedev, Swiatek said he has some superpowers, just never gives up, physically, tactically, he's always there on the court.

58.title: Thomas Cup winners Satwiksairaj-Chirag pull out of Thailand Open
58.article_body: Thomas Cup 2022 winning duo Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty have pulled out of the Thailand Open Super 500 tournament, beginning Tuesday, in Bangkok. It is, reportedly, learnt that Chirag suffered some niggles during the tournament and the pair decided to withdraw. The world number eight pair had lost just one match in India's first-ever Thomas Cup title-winning campaign.

59.title: Uber launches robot-assisted food delivery service in 2 US cities
59.article_body: Uber on Monday said it has launched pilot food delivery services with autonomous vehicles in two cities in US' California. It announced one food delivery service using autonomous cars and a separate pilot using sidewalk robots. Both services are available to users in Santa Monica and West Hollywood and can be opted out of.

60.title: SEBI bans Urja Global, 4 people from securities market for 2 years
60.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has banned energy provider and operator, Urja Global, and four individuals from dealing in the securities market for two years. It found that Urja Global made a false and misleading scheme for a corporate announcement in connection with Nippon Shinyaku. Various other disclosure lapses were also observed.

61.title: 'Doctor Strange' actress Zara jailed for 8 yrs for sexually abusing 13-yr-old girl
61.article_body: 'Doctor Strange' actress Zara Phythian has been jailed for sexually abusing a girl who was aged between 13 and 15 years. The 38-year-old's husband Victor Marke (59) has been jailed for 14 years for abusing the same victim and for the indecent assault of another girl. They were found guilty of 14 counts of sexual activity with a child.

62.title: Sri Lanka plans to privatise national airline to help pay off debt
62.article_body: Sri Lanka's new PM Ranil Wickremesinghe on Monday proposed privatising national airline Sri Lankan Airlines as part of reforms aimed at paying off the economic crisis-hit country's debts. "It shouldn't be that this loss has to be borne by the poorest of the poor," Wickremesinghe said. He added that the airline made a loss of SLR 45 billion in FY21.

63.title: Fire breaks out at shoe factory in Delhi, 9 fire tenders rushed to spot
63.article_body: A fire broke out at a footwear factory in Delhi's Narela industrial area on Monday, Delhi Fire Service officials said. Nine fire tenders have been rushed to the spot, officials added. So far, no casualty has been reported in the incident. The fire was reportedly brought under control and 10 workers were evacuated safely.

64.title: They want to muddy the topic: Jeff Bezos on US govt criticising his recent tweets
64.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos tweeted, "They understandably want to muddy the topic," on the White House's statement about his tweets opposing taxing the rich corporations to tame inflation. It accused Bezos of opposing an "economic agenda for the middle class that cuts some of the biggest costs families face". Earlier, Bezos accused US President Joe Biden of "misdirection" over inflation.

65.title: Cricketer Shikhar Dhawan to make his acting debut soon: Report
65.article_body: Cricketer Shikhar Dhawan will reportedly make his acting debut in a film. "The makers felt that Shikhar suits the character and reached out to him a few months back," a source close to the development was quoted by Pinkvilla. "It's a proper full-length role and is not a cameo. His part is pivotal to the film," the source added.

66.title: Punjab witnessing complete breakdown of law and order: SAD's Badal
66.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) President Sukhbir Singh Badal on Monday said Punjab is witnessing a complete breakdown of law and order. "Instead of providing relief to the common man, CM Bhagwant Mann is holding phony photo-ops...If this is the badlav (change) that AAP promised, then Punjabis are in for one of the worst phases in the state's history," Badal added.

67.title: Akash Madhwal replaces Suryakumar Yadav in Mumbai Indians squad
67.article_body: Mumbai Indians have signed Akash Madhwal as a replacement for Suryakumar Yadav, who was ruled out of IPL 2022 owing to a left forearm muscle injury. Madhwal is a right-arm medium-fast bowler and has represented Uttarakhand across all three formats of the game since making his domestic debut in 2019. He was a part of MI's support team.

68.title: Nadal is my biggest opponent between him and Federer: Djokovic
68.article_body: Acknowledging his rivalry with Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal, world number one Novak Djokovic said that 21-time Grand Slam champion Nadal is the biggest opponent of his career. "I have grown as a player because he [Nadal] has pushed me to it," he added. Djokovic leads Federer 27-23 and Nadal 30-28 in head-to-head on the ATP Tour.

69.title: Insulting: Mishra as IAS officer jokingly credits India's Thomas Cup win to mosquito racquet
69.article_body: Veteran cricketer Amit Mishra reacted to IAS officer Somesh Upadhyay jokingly crediting India's Thomas Cup win to a mosquito racquet. Somesh shared a picture of a mosquito racquet and wrote, "Indonesian are surprised how Indians got better at badminton than them." Mishra responded, "This is not only distasteful but also insulting the achievement of our badminton heroes."

70.title: DC opener Shaw should make a comeback when he's 100% fit: Nikhil
70.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Nikhil Chopra has said DC opener Prithvi Shaw, who was admitted to hospital due to typhoid a few days back, should make a comeback in the team in ongoing IPL if he's feeling 100% fit. He added that if Shaw plays without proper practice sessions, the team will lose him for playoffs if they qualify for the same.

71.title: Pics of Bajrang Dal arms training in K'taka trigger probe, 'used air guns', says Dal
71.article_body: Pictures of a week-long Bajrang Dal arms training camp in Karnataka went viral online, following which the police said that an investigation is being done. The camp with 116 participants was organised in Kodagu and weapons like Trishuls (tridents) were distributed among them. Bajrang Dal, however, said that only air guns were used and the Trishuls distributed 'weren't sharp'.

72.title: 34-yr-old man rapes 11-yr-old girl who ran away from home in Maha
72.article_body: The Vasai police in Maharashtra arrested a 34-year-old man on Sunday for allegedly kidnapping and raping an 11-year-old girl who had gone missing on Saturday, officers said. She took a local train to Mumbai before deciding on returning home. However, she met the accused who raped her before leaving the girl on the road, police said.

73.title: Govt puts Pawan Hans sale on hold over concerns about winning bidder
73.article_body: The Centre has decided to put on hold the sale of its 51% stake in Pawan Hans Limited to Star9 Mobility. The decision was taken after concerns were raised over Almas Global Opportunity Fund, one of the majority stakeholders of Star9 Mobility. NCLT had sanctioned Almas Global over its failure to pay after successfully bidding to acquire Kolkata-based EMC Limited.

74.title: Shailesh Lodha to quit 'Taarak Mehta Ka...' after 14 yrs: Report
74.article_body: Actor Shailesh Lodha, who plays the role of Taarak Mehta in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', will reportedly be quitting the show after almost 14 years. As per a report by ETimes, Shailesh has not shot for the show since the last month and won't return to the show as he is not happy with his current contract.

75.title: Punjab CM Mann launches 'Lok Milni' for grievance redressal of people
75.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann heard the grievances of the people and issued directions for their redressal in a public interaction programme, 'Lok Milni', which was launched on Monday. "This is a humble step of my government to make sure that we facilitate resolution of long-pending administrative issues concerning people," he said.

76.title: Maintain peace, don't disturb environment: Lekhi to Mufti, Owaisi
76.article_body: Union Minister of State for External Affairs Meenakashi Lekhi on Monday told AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti to "maintain peace and brotherhood" and "not disturb the environment". This came after Mufti and Owaisi commented on the Varanasi Court's order to seal the place of the Gyanvapi Mosque where a Shivling was found.

77.title: B'luru Police chief Kamal Pant transferred, CH Pratap Reddy to replace him
77.article_body: The Karnataka government on Monday transferred Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant with immediate effect. CH Pratap Reddy, who held the post of Additional Director General of Police, Law and Order, will replace him until further orders. Pant has been transferred to the post of Director General of Police, Recruitment.

78.title: Entire world is watching, be sensible as a leader: Shami to Hardik
78.article_body: Revealing what advice he gave to GT skipper Hardik Pandya, teammate Mohammad Shami said he told him to control his emotions on the field "because the entire world watches cricket." He added that it's important to be sensible as a leader and he has witnessed a lot of changes in Hardik as a captain in comparison to a player.

79.title: Chlorine gas leaks during water tank demolition in WB, 15 fall ill
79.article_body: Fifteen people fell ill in West Bengal's Murshidabad after chlorine gas leaked during the demolition of an old water tank reservoir in the district's Public Health Engineering Department. A fire official said the incident took place after JCB machines at work "broke the reservoir by mistake". Two patients, who were severely ill, were shifted to a hospital in Berhampur.

80.title: Artistes can succeed only by keeping regional feelings aside: Nagarjuna
80.article_body: Nagarjuna, while hosting 'Bigg Boss Telugu Non-Stop', criticised contestant Nataraj who asked viewers to not vote for co-contestant Bindu as she's from Chennai, adding he'll entertain the audience as he's part of the Telugu industry. Nagarjuna told Natarajan artistes can succeed when they keep their regional feelings aside. "90% film industry was in Chennai before the states split," he added.

81.title: India overtakes Germany as 4th largest vehicle market: Report
81.article_body: India surpassed Germany to become the world's fourth largest automotive market in 2021, data by the Organisation Internationale des Constructeurs d'Automobiles (OICA) showed. As per the data, India saw 3,759,398 vehicles sold in 2021, compared to 2,973,319 vehicles in Germany. The most number of vehicles were sold in China, followed by the US and Japan.

82.title: Warner changes end at last second to face Livingstone, gets out on 1st ball; video viral
82.article_body: DC opener David Warner changed his end at the last second to face PBKS Liam Livingstone on the first ball of his team's innings and got out on the first ball. DC's Sarfaraz Khan was ready to face the first ball, however, Warner decided to take strike after knowing Livingstone was bowling the first over.

83.title: No shivling found, there's only a fountain: Gyanvapi Mosque Committee's lawyer
83.article_body: Rais Ahmad Ansari, an advocate of the Anjuman Intezamia Masjid Committee that manages the Gyanvapi Mosque, has called petitioners' claim about a 'Shivling' being found at the mosque "misleading". "There's only a fountain in the mosque's wazu khana," Ansari said. His statement came after a court in UP's Varanasi ordered the sealing of the spot where 'Shivling' was reportedly found.

84.title: Elon Musk considers visit to Indonesia over possible investments
84.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is considering a visit to Indonesia to explore investment opportunities. As per Indonesian President Joko Widodo's office, Musk said to Widodo, "Hopefully in November...thank you for the invitation," after the two met in Texas on Saturday. Indonesia, which has some of the largest nickel deposits, has been in talks with Musk's team over electric vehicles development.

85.title: Don't remember last OTT show I was excited about: Abhishek Banerjee
85.article_body: Abhishek Banerjee, speaking about the OTT platforms, has said, "There is a saturation which is definitely going to come in." "I don't remember the last show which I was excited about...also the kind of shows which come your way, you don't see the excitement level which we saw probably in projects we've done," he added. Abhishek starred in 'Paatal Lok'.

86.title: No merit: Aditya Birla Capital on report claiming corruption caused CEO's exit
86.article_body: Aditya Birla Capital (ABC) on Monday said outgoing CEO Ajay Srinivasan is transitioning to a new role being crafted at the group level. This comes after a news report, citing a whistleblower letter, alleged that Srinivasan was asked to leave due to corruption, insider trading and front running. "These insinuations/allegations are bereft of facts," said the ABC spokesperson.

87.title: Fire breaks out at shelters for Central Vista project workers, no casualties
87.article_body: A fire broke out in three temporary shelters for workers involved in the Central Vista project near Parliament House in central Delhi on Monday, officials said. No casualties were reported in the incident, they said, adding that mattresses and household items were destroyed in the fire. Five fire tenders reached the spot and doused the blaze within an hour.

88.title: Unwarranted comments: India on Islamic nations' remarks on J&K delimitation
88.article_body: India on Monday criticised the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation (OIC), calling its comments on the delimitation exercise in Jammu and Kashmir "unwarranted". "OIC should refrain from carrying out its communal agenda vis-a-vis India at the behest of one country," said the External Affairs Ministry. The 57-member OIC had criticised India over the delimitation exercise during a meeting in Pakistan.

89.title: China building infrastructure near Arunachal border: Indian Army
89.article_body: Indian Army's General Officer Commanding-in chief of the Eastern command Lieutenant General RP Kalita on Monday said China's People's Liberation Army is engaged in infrastructure capacity enhancement across the international border in Arunachal Pradesh. Border villages built by Chinese authorities can be used for dual purposes, he said. "We are continuously monitoring the situation," he added.

90.title: Rahul’s comments on regional parties bizarre, out of sync: RJD
90.article_body: Responding to Rahul Gandhi's comments on regional parties, Rashtriya Janata Dal on Monday said that his comments were bizarre and out of sync with Congress' own declaration. In his address at his party's 'Chintan Shivir' in Udaipur, Gandhi had claimed that regional parties cannot fight the BJP-RSS as they lack ideology. Congress can fight it, he said.

91.title: Fearless Arshdeep flourishes under pressure situations for PBKS: Harbhajan
91.article_body: Calling Arshdeep Singh a "fearless bowler" with a "lion's heart", ex-India spinner Harbhajan Singh said the PBKS pacer has the quality to flourish in the pressure situations in ongoing IPL. "There's so much confidence in this bowler and the belief that he can do well during tense moments...he bowls yorkers at will in the death overs," he added.

92.title: BCCI announce squads for 2022 Women's T20 Challenge
92.article_body: The BCCI have announced squads for the 2022 Women's T20 Challenge. Harmanpreet Kaur, Smriti Mandhana and Deepti Sharma have been named captains of Supernovas, Trailblazers and Velocity, respectively. The Women's T20 Challenge will begin with the Trailblazers taking on Supernovas in the opening game on May 23. The final will take place on May 28.

93.title: Wife forcing husband to separate from parents amounts to mental cruelty: HC
93.article_body: If a wife continuously insists that her husband separate from his parents and threatens to implicate him in a false dowry demand case, it would amount to mental cruelty, the Chhattisgarh HC ruled. It said this while hearing a man's petition challenging the order of a family court, which had rejected his plea to seek divorce on grounds of cruelty.

94.title: Muslims not ready to lose another mosque after Babri Masjid: Owaisi
94.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that Muslims aren't ready to lose another mosque after Babri Masjid, following the Varanasi Court order to seal the place in the Gyanvapi Mosque where a Shivling was found. "This is a textbook repeat of December 1949 in Babri Masjid. This order itself changes the religious nature of the masjid," he said.

95.title: I won't lie, next couple of months to be most difficult ones: Sri Lanka PM to citizens
95.article_body: Sri Lanka's new PM Ranil Wickremesinghe on Monday warned the economic crisis-hit country's citizens, "The next couple of months will be the most difficult ones of our lives." He added, "I have no desire to hide the truth and to lie to the public." He said Sri Lanka's budget deficit stands at SLR 2.4 trillion (13% of the country's GDP).

96.title: Tamil Nadu CM writes to PM Modi over rising prices of cotton, yarn
96.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Monday wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi seeking his immediate intervention to solve the "serious disruptions" faced by the textile industry in the state. Stalin said despite the Union government withdrawing import duty levied on cotton, the prices of cotton and yarn have been continuously on the rise.

97.title: Anjali & I being close in 'Lock Upp' wasn't easy for Nazila: Munawar
97.article_body: 'Lock Upp' season 1 winner Munawar Faruqui has revealed that his closeness with co-contestant Anjali Arora on the show was not easy for his girlfriend Nazila Sitaishi. "Nazila went through a lot of emotions, but in the end, she understood the game and supported me," he stated. Munawar added that Nazila had "complete trust" in him.

98.title: Sri Lanka left with only one day of petrol stock, warns new PM
98.article_body: Sri Lanka's new PM Ranil Wickremesinghe in an address to the nation on Monday said, "At the moment, we only have petrol stocks for a single day." He said the crisis-hit country urgently needed $75 million in foreign exchange to pay for essential imports. "The next couple of months will be the most difficult ones of our lives," he added.

99.title: 4 killed as rains trigger landslides in Arunachal, 1 still trapped
99.article_body: Four persons were killed in landslides triggered by incessant rainfall in Arunachal Pradesh's Itanagar, police said. Itanagar SP Jimmy Chiram said a woman is still trapped under debris after a house collapsed due to the impact of a landslide, killing two people. "Rescue operations are going on to evacuate her," Chiram added. Three other persons sustained injuries in the incident.

100.title: I still hear screams & people begging for help: Mundka fire survivor
100.article_body: One of the survivors of the Mundka fire incident, Mamata, recounted her escape and said, "It is like a video continuously playing in my head. I still hear screams and people begging for help." The 45-year-old, who is a resident of Parvesh Nagar in Delhi, said she could still feel the smoke. Mamata suffered injuries on her hands and foot.

101.title: Felt really nice speaking to PM Modi after Thomas Cup win: Srikanth
101.article_body: India's badminton player Kidambi Srikanth has said that the Indian badminton team's first-ever Thomas Cup win is a victory for every Indian. Talking about speaking to PM Narendra Modi after winning the tournament, Srikanth said, "I...didn't expect that...It felt...nice speaking to him immediately after the match." He added PM Modi keeping a track of players and their performances is "amazing".

102.title: People of Nepal equally happy over building of Ram Temple: PM Modi
102.article_body: PM Narendra Modi during his visit to Nepal on Monday, said people of Nepal are as happy as Indians over building of a grand Lord Ram Temple in India. "In Janakpur, I'd said that 'Our Ram is also incomplete without Nepal'," he added. He said his birthplace in Gujarat's Vadnagar was also a great centre of Buddhist learning, centuries ago.

103.title: Felt that season didn't really start for us till first win: MI's David
103.article_body: Speaking about bottom-placed MI's form in IPL 2022, MI batter Tim David stated the season didn't start for them until they won their first match following eight consecutive losses. "Since then, we've played some really good cricket," he added. "We've won three of our last four games and there has been a good feeling in the team," David further said.

104.title: I'd rate myself as one of the favourites at 2022 French Open: Djokovic
104.article_body: Talking about his chances of winning the title at upcoming French Open, Novak Djokovic said he would rate himself as one of the favourites following his form in the last few weeks. The world number one won his first title of 2022 in Rome on Sunday. Before this, Djokovic lost in Serbia Open final and in semi-final in Madrid Open.

105.title: Adani offers to buy 26% of Ambuja, ACC for $6.5 bn after $10.5 bn Holcim deal
105.article_body: Gautam Adani has made an open offer to acquire a 26% stake each in Ambuja Cements and ACC from public shareholders for $6.5 billion. A day ago, Adani announced a $10.5 billion deal to acquire Holcim's India business. Notably, Holcim holds 63.19% in Ambuja Cements and 54.53% in ACC (of which 50.05% is held through Ambuja Cements).

106.title: Bharti accused of insulting Sikhs as her video mocking beards goes viral, apologises
106.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh has been accused of hurting the sentiments of the Sikh community in an old video where she's heard mocking beards and moustaches. Following the backlash, Singh issued a video statement saying, "I haven't mentioned any religion or caste in the video...But if people from any religion...have been hurt...I apologise to them with folded hands."

107.title: Global wheat prices hit record high after India bans export
107.article_body: After India banned wheat exports earlier this week, wheat prices touched a new record high of €435 ($453) per tonne as the Euronext market opened on Monday. The prices had reached the previous record high of €422 on Friday, as supplies from Russia and Ukraine (both major wheat exporters) have been disrupted. Wheat futures traded in Chicago also rose 5.9%.

108.title: Russell is one of the guys who can do special things: KKR's Southee
108.article_body: KKR pacer Tim Southee has said that his teammate and all-rounder Andre Russell is having a "tremendous" IPL 2022. "There are a few guys around the world that can do special things and Andre Russell's one of those guys," he further added. In the ongoing IPL 2022, Russell has scored 330 runs and has taken 17 wickets in 13 matches.

109.title: World's second-largest economy China's retail sales fall to lowest in over 2 years
109.article_body: Retail sales of the world's second-largest economy, China, slumped to its lowest in over two years while factory output plunged, official data showed. It's the biggest slump since March 2020 as Chinese consumers remained mostly at home amid coronavirus restrictions. This also comes amid China and its business hub Shanghai adhering to strict coronavirus measures, negatively affecting supply chains.

110.title: IAS officer accused in ₹18cr fraud in J'khand sent to 4-day ED remand
110.article_body: A Jharkhand court on Monday sent suspended IAS officer and state Mining Secretary Pooja Singhal and her chartered accountant to four-day Enforcement Directorate remand. ED arrested Singhal on May 12 in connection with a money laundering case linked to the alleged embezzlement of ₹18-crore MGNREGA funds. "Data has been collected from digital devices and they'll be confronted," ED lawyer said.

111.title: Man makes fake FB ID of Amit Shah, makes abusive remarks against MLA
111.article_body: A man allegedly created a fake Facebook profile of Union Home Minister Amit Shah and made abusive remarks about former Baikunthpur MLA Mithilesh Tiwari. The incident came to light on Sunday after Tiwari lodged a complaint with the Mohammadpur Police. "We have arrested a person named Vicky Kumar Singh from Devkali village," said Anand Kumar, SHO of Mohammadpur Police Station.

112.title: Non-profit behind collapsed Terra ecosystem to compensate users
112.article_body: The Luna Foundation Guard (LFG), a non-profit organisation that supports the Terra ecosystem, on Monday announced that it will compensate the remaining users of TerraUSD/UST, after the stablecoin collapsed last week. "We're still debating through various distribution methods," the LFG tweeted. It spent millions of dollars worth of crypto trying to defend UST's dollar peg last week, it added.

113.title: B'luru Police chief Kamal Pant transferred, CH Pratap Reddy to replace him
113.article_body: The Karnataka government on Monday transferred Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant with immediate effect. CH Pratap Reddy, who held the post of Additional Director General of Police, Law and Order, will replace him until further orders. Pant has been transferred to the post of Director General of Police, Recruitment.

114.title: Good news: UP Deputy CM on 'Shivling' being found at Gyanvapi Mosque
114.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy CM KP Maurya on Monday said he was happy about reports claiming the existence of a "Shivling" at the Gyanvapi Mosque complex in Varanasi. "The truth has come to light. We will welcome and follow orders of the court in the matter," Maurya said. "The situation in Uttar Pradesh is very good. Everybody is happy," he added.

115.title: Centre should ensure security of Kashmiri Pandits: CM Kejriwal
115.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that the Centre should ensure the security of Kashmiri Pandits. "A Kashmiri Pandit was killed inside his office by terrorists. It seems it was planned. The Indian Army gunned down two terrorists in a day. But the incident has left Kashmiri Pandits scared," CM Kejriwal said in an online briefing.

116.title: Actress Ketaki's phone, laptop seized by police over FB post against Pawar
116.article_body: Marathi actress Ketaki Chitale, who was arrested two days ago over a 'derogatory' Facebook post on NCP chief Sharad Pawar, was on Monday brought to her home in Navi Mumbai by police to collect electronic evidence. Police were at her residence for an hour, where they seized her phone and laptop. Six cases have been filed against the 29-year-old actress.

117.title: PBKS to bowl first against DC, DC make 2 changes to their playing XI
117.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal won the toss and elected to bowl first against DC in their IPL 2022 clash on Monday. PBKS are fielding the same playing XI, while DC have made two changes to their playing XI. Khaleel Ahmed and Sarfaraz Khan have replaced Chetan Sakariya and KS Bharat, respectively.

118.title: Brabourne Stadium is a tough place to bowl: RR pacer Trent Boult
118.article_body: RR pacer Trent Boult, who picked two wickets against LSG at the Brabourne Stadium, said that it is a tough place to bowl. Speaking about his performance, Boult said, "Nice to get wickets at the top. I've got a simple game with the ball." Rajasthan defeated Lucknow by 24 runs and Boult was adjudged Player of the Match.

119.title: US FDA warns Sun Pharma over quality lapses at Gujarat plant: Report
119.article_body: The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has flagged production-related quality control and procedural lapses at India's largest drugmaker Sun Pharma's facility in Gujarat's Halol, it has been reported. The health authority reportedly also observed deficient equipment and laboratory standards. It conducted a good manufacturing inspection there from April 26 to May 9.

120.title: Pics of Taj Mahal's underground cells, before & after maintenance, released
120.article_body: The Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) recently released some photographs of the Taj Mahal's underground cells, showing the state of the rooms before and after conservation work. It said the maintenance work was undertaken in the rooms on the riverside and decayed and disintegrated lime plaster was removed. This comes amid a controversy over the 22 locked rooms.

121.title: Renault sells Russia business for 1 ruble to govt-backed entity: Reports
121.article_body: French automaker Renault reached a deal to sell its Russia business and its majority 68% stake in Russia's biggest automaker AvtoVAZ for one ruble, reports said on Monday. Renault's stake in AvtoVAZ would be sold to the state-backed Russian Central Research and Development Automobile and Engine Institute. Renault sold its AvtoVAZ stake with a six-year option to buy it back.

122.title: India-Nepal relations unshakeable like Himalayas: PM in Lumbini
122.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, speaking at the Buddhist Conference in Nepal's Lumbini, said the relationship between India and Nepal is "unshakable like the Himalayas". "The growing...friendship between India and Nepal will work for the benefit of entire humanity amid the kind of global situation that is emerging today," he added. "The devotion to Lord Buddha binds us together," the PM said.

123.title: SC directs IIT to award degree to 'learning disabled' student
123.article_body: Supreme Court has directed the Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay (IIT-B) to award a student suffering from 'learning disabilities' his degree in Master in Design, declaring that the student has successfully completed it. The bench of Justices directed IIT-B to take appropriate steps including handing over the degree and all other testimonials to the appellant, Naman Verma, within four weeks.

124.title: Every player stepped up when it mattered: Srikanth on India's Thomas Cup win
124.article_body: Shuttler Kidambi Srikanth, who remained undefeated in India's maiden Thomas Cup title-winning campaign, said his performance in final against Indonesia was one of his best. He added, "I don't think this is one individual's win, it's about all 10 players. Everyone stepped up when it mattered." Srikanth beat Jonatan Christie 21-15, 23-21 in third match, helping India beat Indonesia 3-0.

125.title: Stones hurled at Dalit man's wedding venue in MP, 5 arrested
125.article_body: A group of people allegedly threw stones at the wedding venue of a Dalit man in Madhya Pradesh, following which the marriage procession was taken out under police protection, an official said on Monday. A case was registered against 40 people, including 18 unidentified persons, while five were arrested, the official added.

126.title: IndiGo handled passengers inappropriately: DGCA as special needs boy denied boarding
126.article_body: DGCA on Monday revealed findings of its inquiry into the Ranchi incident, where a specially-abled boy wasn't allowed to board a flight. It said that prima facie, the airline staff 'handled passengers inappropriately'. The incident resulted in "certain non-conformances with the applicable regulations" by IndiGo, the aviation regulator said. It also issued a show-cause notice to the airline.

127.title: Not worried at all: Sourav Ganguly on Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's form
127.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly has said that he is not worried at all about the form of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in IPL 2022. He added, "They are too good…real big players. The T20 World Cup 2022 is far away and I am quite confident that they will be in top shape much before the tournament."

128.title: No heatwave in Delhi for next 4 days: IMD
128.article_body: The ongoing heatwave in Delhi and other north Indian states will abate from Tuesday for the next four days, IMD senior scientist RK Jenamani said. On Sunday, Mungeshpur and Najafgarh observatories in Delhi recorded 49.2 degrees Celsius and 49.1 degrees Celsius respectively. "In May, the first 10 days were good...I don't think it'll be very unusual this month," he added.

129.title: 432 fined in 2 days for driving on wrong side of road in Gurugram
129.article_body:
At least 432 people were fined in two days for driving on the wrong side during a road safety drive launched by the Gurugram Traffic Police to reduce accidents in the city. 
According to traffic police officials, around 15% of the road fatalities in the city happen due to wrong-side driving. A fine of ₹500 is issued for wrong-side driving.

130.title: US-based customers use Tesla cars to mine $800/month in crypto
130.article_body: Tesla owners are using their cars as a power source to mine cryptocurrency. San Francisco-based Siraj Raval hacked his Model 3's onboard internal firmware to mine up to $800 worth of cryptocurrency every month. Wisconsin-based Chris Allessi connected a power inverter and a bitcoin miner to his Model S' battery to mine bitcoin and monero.

131.title: Actress Neena Gupta's autobiography to be adapted into a film
131.article_body: Veteran actress Neena Gupta has revealed that someone has "shown an interest" in adapting her autobiography 'Sach Kahun Toh' into a film. When asked about whether she has an actor in mind to play her onscreen, the actress said, "Mere kehne se kya hota hai (It doesn't matter what I say). The producer will decide who is fit for it."

132.title: 2nd-set tie-breaker was vintage him: Roddick on Djokovic's Italian Open win
132.article_body: Praising Novak Djokovic following his 6-0, 7-6(7-5) win over Stefanos Tsitsipas to clinch his record-extending 38th ATP Masters 1000 title at Italian Open on Sunday, ex-world number one Andy Roddick said, "Second-set tie-breaker was vintage Novak." The top-seed took an early lead in tie-break before Tsitsipas levelled the score. However, Djokovic converted on his very first match point at 6-5.

133.title: Pics of 'underground city' in Finland's capital surface amid Russian attack fears
133.article_body: Pictures of Finnish capital Helsinki's 'underground city' with hundreds of bunkers have surfaced online, amid fears of Russian retaliation against Finland's bid to join NATO. The underground city can reportedly shelter 900,000 people, a third more than Helsinki's population of 600,000 people, for months in case of a war. The hidden city has a swimming pool and a hockey rink.

134.title: WhatsApp Pay to display user's legal name to avoid UPI frauds
134.article_body: WhatsApp will now display users' legal name for every transaction they make on WhatsApp Pay to mitigate fraud on UPI payments system. The company said the name associated with a user's bank account, identified using their phone number on WhatsApp, is the name that will be shared. WhatsApp users have the choice to pick any name on the app.

135.title: Which Indian women wrestlers have qualified for Commonwealth Games 2022?
135.article_body: As many as six Indian women wrestlers have qualified for Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022. Pooja Gehlot and Vinesh Phogat have qualified for the 50kg and 53kg categories, respectively. Meanwhile, Anshu Malik, Sakshi Malik and Divya Kakran have qualified for 57kg, 62kg and 68kg events, respectively. Pooja Dhanda will participate in the 76kg event at CWG 2022.

136.title: Water supply to be affected in parts of Delhi from tomorrow
136.article_body: Parts of Delhi will face disruption in water supply from Tuesday morning due to depletion of pond level of Yamuna river at Wazirabad and reduction in release of raw water from Haryana, Delhi Jal Board said. The water supply will remain affected till the pond level improves to normal. Kamla Nagar and Karol Bagh are among the affected areas.

137.title: Heard is a sociopath, wants to destroy Depp: His friend Gina Deuters
137.article_body: Johnny Depp's longtime friend and his business partner Stephen Deuters' wife Gina has said that Amber Heard "wants to destroy" ex-husband Johnny Depp. Gina further stated that Stephen called Heard "a sociopathic showbiz pony" when he was mediating the couple before their marriage ended. Depp is suing Heard for defamation following her claim of being a victim of sexual violence.

138.title: Autos in Gautam Buddha Nagar told to fix meter, end arbitrary fares
138.article_body: Auto-rickshaws without meters will not be allowed to ply on Noida and Greater Noida roads in a bid by Gautam Buddha Nagar transport department to stop them from charging arbitrary fares, officials said. Fitness certificate will also be mandatory for auto-rickshaws plying in the twin-cities. Legal action will be taken against erring drivers, Assistant Regional Transport Officer AK Pandey said.

139.title: Goldman Sachs allows senior employees to take unlimited leaves
139.article_body: Goldman Sachs will allow partners and managing directors to take as much time off as they want under a new "flexible vacation" to "rest and recharge", according to an internal memo. "As of May 1, there will be no cap on paid leave and senior staff can take time off without a fixed vacation day entitlement," the memo said.

140.title: Mumbai doctor assaulted, robbed by youth he met on gay dating app
140.article_body: A senior doctor was assaulted and his iPhone and wallet were stolen by four persons in Mumbai. The victim had met one of the accused on a gay dating application, where the accused youth asked him to meet him at a secluded place. "The accused targeted victims on dating application assuming they would not approach the police," an officer said.

141.title: 4 tourists killed, 3 injured as car falls into gorge in Himachal
141.article_body: Four tourists were killed and three others injured after an SUV in which they were travelling fell into a gorge in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district on Monday. The car had a Delhi registration number, police said. The injured passengers, including two women, were admitted to a hospital, the police added.

142.title: Samantha shares 1st poster of 'Kushi', fans say 'Release in Hindi'
142.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu shared the first poster of her upcoming film with Vijay Deverakonda titled 'Kushi' on social media on Monday. The film will be releasing in four languages including Tamil, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam. A social media user commented, "Sam why not in Hindi," while another wrote, "Hindi me bhi release krdo...Thodi daya krdo hum pr bhi."

143.title: Kuldeep Yadav & I can communicate without even speaking: Chahal
143.article_body: Yuzvendra Chahal, speaking about his relationship with spinner Kuldeep Yadav, has said, "I have the kind of bond with him where we can communicate without even speaking." In the ongoing IPL 2022, RR's Chahal is currently the purple cap-holder with 24 wickets in 13 matches so far. DC's Kuldeep has 18 wickets in 12 matches in the tournament so far.

144.title: PBKS are a more settled line-up with Bairstow at the top: Lisa
144.article_body: Ex-Australia cricketer Lisa Sthalekar has opined that Punjab Kings are a more settled batting lineup with batter Jonny Bairstow playing as an opener. "Bairstow's numbers opening the batting in the IPL are outstanding," she said. Talking about Bairstow's 29-ball 66 runs versus RCB, she said, "He's too much of a class player...we saw that at Brabourne Stadium against RCB."

145.title: Babil Khan shares pics with late father Irrfan, reveals motivation
145.article_body: Actor Babil Khan took to social media on Monday to share a series of childhood pictures with his father late actor Irrfan Khan and a picture of his mother Sutapa when she was pregnant. Babil wrote in the caption, "The motivation to endure the torment of being in this industry is stubborn because it's beyond personal desires."

146.title: Kiara not approached for Prabhas-starrer 'Spirit': Kiara's spokesperson
146.article_body: Earlier reports surfaced that Kiara Advani will be seen opposite Prabhas in Sandeep Reddy's film 'Spirit', however, Kiara's spokesperson confirmed that she hasn't been approached for the film. "In case of any update, we'd officially announce and inform everyone. Hence, kindly request everyone to refrain from indulging in the rumours," her spokesperson said.

147.title: DC's David Warner will be very valuable in match vs PBKS: Piyush
147.article_body: Piyush Chawla said DC opener David Warner will be "very valuable" in the match against PBKS. "Warner will play the big innings, holding one end for his team. He'll take all the pressure on himself...give others the chance to come and score quickly," Chawla added. Warner is IPL 2022's third-highest runscorer with 427 runs in 10 matches so far.

148.title: Activists block docking of ship 'carrying Russian diesel' in UK
148.article_body: Greenpeace on Monday said that its activists stopped an oil tanker carrying "33,000 tonnes of Russian diesel" from docking in the UK's Essex. The environmental organisation added that they did so in a protest against buying Russian fossil fuels which will "fund" the war in Ukraine. Meanwhile, the police said that eight people have been arrested in the matter.

149.title: PBKS should replace Harpreet Brar with Sandeep Sharma against DC: Chopra
149.article_body: Former India batter Aakash Chopra has suggested that PBKS should play with pacer Sandeep Sharma instead of left-arm spinner Harpreet Brar against DC on Monday. "If you look at Delhi's line-up, you will find (left-handers) David Warner, Rishabh Pant and Axar Patel as well...In the match-ups, Sandeep Sharma could be more than a handful," Chopra said.

150.title: Kejriwal trying to scare people over anti-encroachment drive: BJP
150.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal is trying to "scare and blackmail" people over the BJP-ruled civic bodies' anti-encroachment drive, Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta said on Monday. However, Bangladeshis, Rohingyas, rioters and those involved in illegal activities, “who are protected by the Aam Aadmi Party”, won't be spared, Gupta said. Centre has given ownership rights to 40 lakh people, he added.

151.title: Boring work for Namma Metro suspended 713 times due to geological conditions
151.article_body: The boring work for Namma Metro has been suspended 713 times due to unfavourable geological conditions. Underground rocks and rocky soil have made it more difficult for Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) to complete the Namma Metro's phase 2 underground section. Reports said cutter discs are worn out or there is a delay in installing suitable ones.

152.title: BJP after all our mosques: Mehbooba Mufti on Gyanvapi mosque case
152.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti on Monday, while criticising the BJP-led central government over the Gyanvapi mosque case, said, "They are after all our mosques." "Our God is wherever we worship. Give us a list of all mosques you are eyeing," she added. "Would everything be okay when they take all of it?" the PDP chief asked.

153.title: Adani Group liable for fines on Ambuja Cements & ACC; no tax liability for Holcim
153.article_body: The Holcim Group has said that there will be no indemnity or tax liability for them in its $10.5 billion transaction where it sold its stake in Ambuja Cements and ACC to the Adani Group. The Adani group is now liable for anti-trust fines against Ambuja Cements and ACC in India which are being litigated in the Supreme Court.

154.title: Hope it doesn't affect my car insurance: Alan Ritchson on joining 'Fast X'
154.article_body: Alan Ritchson, who plays Jack Reacher in series 'Reacher', has joined the cast of 'Fast X', the 10th instalment in the 'Fast and Furious' franchise. The actor, in an Instagram post, confirmed the news, writing, "Really hope this doesn't affect my car insurance." The film, directed by Louis Leterrier, will also feature Vin Diesel along with Jason Momoa and others.

155.title: You make everything better: Katrina on husband Vicky Kaushal's b'day
155.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif wished her husband, actor Vicky Kaushal on his 34th birthday. Taking to Instagram, Katrina shared pictures with Vicky from New York along with a message. She wrote, "New York wala birthday. My love. Simply put, you make everything better." Reacting to the post, Vicky wrote, "Shaadishuda wala Birthday!"

156.title: Took 50 wickets in last 10 Ranji games, Test cricket is still my priority: Chahal
156.article_body: India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who's yet to make his Test debut, has said that playing the longest format of the game is still his "first priority". He added, "I [took] 50 wickets in my last 10 Ranji Trophy matches...I think being called a Test player has a different aura." Notably, Chahal last played a first-class match in December 2018.

157.title: Married woman stabbed to death by former lover in Andhra's Bapatla
157.article_body: A married woman was allegedly stabbed to death by a man, with whom she allegedly had extramarital relations in the past, in a village located in Andhra Pradesh's Bapatla district. The deceased, identified as Sharada (27), was chased by the accused, identified as Padma Rao, who ran away after stabbing her neck, the deceased's mother alleged.

158.title: Forest fire breaks out near Kasauli's air force station; 4 injured
158.article_body: A forest fire that broke out near the air force station in Himachal Pradesh's Kasauli on Sunday has been brought under control a day later, according to officials. Four people, including three firemen, were injured in the incident. "It was tough. The relentless efforts of the air force personnel and firefighters finally yielded result," the town's sub-divisional magistrate said.

159.title: Another grave mistake: Russia on Finland, Sweden's decision of joining NATO
159.article_body: Russia on Monday warned that decisions by Finland and Sweden to join the NATO military alliance were serious mistakes and Moscow would take measures. "This is another grave mistake with far-reaching consequences," Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov said. "They should have no illusions that we will just put up with this," he added.

160.title: Wasn't easy to step into the shoes of Rannvijay: Sood on 'Roadies'
160.article_body: Sonu Sood, speaking about replacing Rannvijay Singha as the host of the show 'Roadies', said that it was not easy for him initially to step into the shoes of Rannvijay. "After shooting for 40-45 days in South Africa, I realised that I connected with the ex as well as new roadies and it was like a family reunion," he added.

161.title: Lack of rain to blame for intense, prolonged heatwave in Delhi: IMD
161.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) said that the lack of rain is the primary catalyst for the intense and prolonged heat spell across the region, with Delhi also not recording any significant western disturbances. A western disturbance is expected on Monday and on May 21, but they're unlikely to bring any rain, reports said.

162.title: Thieves return temple idols claiming they had 'nightmares' after theft in UP
162.article_body: Thieves have returned 14 of the 16 idols that they stole from an ancient Balaji temple in UP's Chitrakoot, police said on Monday. The idols worth crores were found in a sack near the Mahant's residence with a letter from the thieves, officials said. The thieves wrote they were having 'scary dreams' at night after committing the crime, they added.

163.title: Disgusting when people make fun of overweight & underweight people: Paresh
163.article_body: During an interview, actor Paresh Rawal said it looks "ugly and disgusting" when people make fun of disabled, overweight and underweight people. He added, "People who make a laughing stock out of such topics should be punished." Praising Kapil Sharma's style of comedy, Paresh said, "He has the capacity to bring laughter with...lines which have no humour in them."

164.title: Arshdeep is keeping big players like Dhoni, Hardik silent in death overs: Irfan
164.article_body: Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan has praised PBKS pacer Arshdeep Singh, stating that the 23-year-old is a special player, who's going to be the "next big thing" for the franchise. "He's keeping big players like MS Dhoni, Hardik Pandya or someone else silent in the death overs and that speaks volumes about the kind of talent he possesses," added Irfan.

165.title: Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker get legally married in California
165.article_body: Kourtney Kardashian and Travis Barker got legally married in an intimate ceremony in California's Santa Barbara on Sunday, reports said. Pictures from the ceremony have also surfaced online with Kardashian seen in a short white dress and Barker in a black suit. One of the pictures showed the couple riding in a car with a 'Just Married' sign.

166.title: Bitcoin has no future as a payments network: FTX's billionaire CEO
166.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange FTX's 30-year-old billionaire CEO, Sam Bankman-Fried, has said that Bitcoin has no future as a payments network, Financial Times reported. The billionaire also criticised the digital currency for its inefficiency and high environmental costs. Later in a tweet, he clarified, "To be clear, I also said that it does have potential as a store of value."

167.title: Mahesh Babu's 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata' crosses ₹100-crore mark worldwide
167.article_body: Mahesh Babu's action drama 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata' has crossed the ₹100-crore mark worldwide. As per a tweet by production house Mythri Movie Makers, the Parasuram directorial has earned more than ₹103 crore at the worldwide box office. The film, which was released on May 12, also stars Keerthy Suresh, Nadiya Moidu and Sowmyaa Menon among others in pivotal roles.

168.title: Tesla recalls 1,07,293 China-made vehicles due to overheating
168.article_body: Tesla is recalling 1,07,293 China-made Model 3 and Model Y vehicles due to overheating that may cause the centre touchscreen display to malfunction, China's market regulatory agency said on Monday. As per the State Administration for Market Regulation, the overheating could also lead to windshield settings and gear displays malfunctions. Last week, Tesla recalled 1,30,000 vehicles in the US.

169.title: No one can harm AIADMK till I am here: Expelled leader Sasikala
169.article_body: Expelled AIADMK leader VK Sasikala has said that no one can harm the party as long as she is around. Speaking at a wedding ceremony on Sunday, she added, "Just as it [the party] recovered every time, the party will be revived and until then I will not rest." Sasikala urged party workers to be patient.

170.title: UP cow slaughter suspect's mother killed during raid, police booked for murder
170.article_body: A 50-year-old woman died after being shot during a police raid in a village in Uttar Pradesh. Police had gone to the village to apprehend the woman's son, a suspect in a cow slaughter case. The villagers allegedly attacked the police team with stones and fired gunshots, following which police opened fire. Unnamed police personnel have been booked for murder.

171.title: Shehnaaz to play the role of South Indian woman in 'Kabhi Eid...': Reports
171.article_body: Shehnaaz Gill will reportedly play the role of a South Indian woman in Salman Khan-starrer 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'. Photos and videos of the actress from a shoot have gone viral on social media platforms. In a leaked video, reportedly from the sets of 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali', Shehnaaz is seen getting down from her vanity van in her costume.

172.title: Won't lie, there's a bit of pressure now: Rahul on LSG's loss vs RR
172.article_body: Following their 24-run loss against RR in IPL 2022, LSG captain KL Rahul said, "I won't lie, yes, there is a bit of pressure," as they are placed third on the points table. Notably, a win against RR would have guaranteed LSG a top-two finish. "We could've so easily been sitting today and could have qualified [for playoffs]," he added.

173.title: 50% of tourism in India is because of Mughals: Mehbooba Mufti
173.article_body: Former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti on Monday said 50% of the tourism in India is because of Mughals. "BJP wants to destroy the tourism sector in India," Mufti added. "They are after all our mosques. They are after the Gyanvapi Mosque now. Our God is wherever we worship. Give us a list of all mosques you are eyeing," Mufti stated.

174.title: Over 41,000 people from 222 villages affected in Assam floods: ASDMA
174.article_body: The Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA) flood report has revealed that over 41,000 people from 222 villages have been affected by the recent flash floods and landslides that have occurred in the state. Notably, the report also said that around 1,685 affected individuals have been rescued and taken to relief camps.

175.title: Harsh Goenka lists 'Top 10 startup mistakes', includes poor hiring, lack of focus
175.article_body: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka tweeted a graph and captioned it as 'Top 10 startup mistakes'. As per the graph, the three biggest mistakes made by start-ups are building something nobody wants, poor hiring and lack of focus. These are followed by failure to execute sales and marketing, not having the right co-founders and chasing investors and not customers.

176.title: My character was a spoilt brat with wounded heart: Preity on 19 yrs of Armaan
