176.article_body: As Preity Zinta's film 'Armaan' completed 19 years, she took to her Instagram handle and shared a video of the movie's song titled 'Mere Dil Ka Tumse' which also features actor Anil Kapoor. She wrote, "Uff! Armaan! This film was special in so many ways. I got to experience a complex 'Sonia', a psychotic spoilt brat with a wounded heart."

177.title: Win was satisfying, atmosphere is chilled, nice: Samson
177.article_body: RR captain Sanju Samson said that the win against LSG was satisfying and the atmosphere in camp is "chilled and nice". Samson, however, also added that it's not easy to maintain such an atmosphere when there are defeats. "Batting first suits our approach well, we want to bat positively...[as] the bowling unit is good," he further said.

178.title: Heavy traffic at Mumbai's Eastern Express due to closure of JVLR flyover
178.article_body: Heavy traffic jam has been witnessed since Saturday at Mumbai's Eastern Express Highway because of Jogeshwari-Vikhroli Link Road (JVLR) flyover being shut due to some ongoing repair work. A large chunk of the jam is being witnessed from Mumbai to Thane and Powai to Thane routes. The traffic jam will remain the same till May 24, officials said.

179.title: First commercial flight takes off from Yemen capital in years
179.article_body: Yemen's national airline on Monday flew its first commercial plane from capital Sanaa in almost six years. The flight, which was bound for Amman in Jordan, carried dozens of Yemenis, including patients travelling to get medical treatment. This comes after the UN brokered a two-month truce between the Saudi-led coalition and the Iran-backed Houthi rebels.

180.title: BJP govt destroyed economy, wants to create 2 Hindustans: Rahul
180.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday accused PM Narendra Modi of destroying the economy and said that BJP wants to create two Hindustans, with one for the rich and the second for Dalits and farmers. "The BJP government has attacked our economy. PM did demonetisation, wrongly implemented GST, due to which the economy got destroyed," he said.

181.title: 'The Kashmir Files' has given birth to hate in country: Farooq Abdullah
181.article_body: National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah on Monday said that he met LG Manoj Sinha to raise the issue of the law and order situation in Jammu and Kashmir. "During the meeting, I told him that the film 'The Kashmir Files' has given birth to hate in the country," Abdullah added. "Such things (films) should be banned," Abdullah stated.

182.title: Delhi policeman out to catch man in stabbing case stabbed by same accused
182.article_body: A Delhi Police official who had gone to catch an accused involved in a stabbing incident was stabbed by the same accused. The accused, Virender, stabbed head constable Praveen when he and Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) Sanjeev went to raid Virender's premises. The ASI then fired a shot in self-defence that hit Virender in the leg.

183.title: MGK dedicates BBMAs performance to 'wife' Megan Fox, 'unborn child'
183.article_body: Singer Machine Gun Kelly dedicated one of the songs from his performance at the Billboard Music Awards 2022 to his "wife" actress Megan Fox instigating rumours of the couple having married in a secret ceremony. The singer also dedicated a song to their "unborn child" which is being considered a pregnancy announcement from the couple by their fans.

184.title: McDonald's to exit Russia after 32 years, sell its business in the country
184.article_body: McDonald's on Monday said it's selling its Russian business, marking the American fast-food chain's exit from Russia after 32 years in the country. McDonald's cited humanitarian crisis caused by the Russia-Ukraine war, adding that its Russian business "is no longer tenable, nor is it consistent with McDonald's values". McDonald's has 850 restaurants in Russia that employ 62,000 people.

185.title: Hetmyer likely to be available for RR's game against CSK on May 20
185.article_body: RR's Shimron Hetmyer, who had left the bio-bubble to travel back to Guyana for the birth of his first child, has rejoined the squad and is likely to be available for their last league match on May 20 against CSK. Hetmyer missed matches against DC and LSG. RR defeated LSG on Sunday to register their eighth win of IPL 2022.

186.title: JD(U) fields Anil Hegde for Bihar Rajya Sabha by-poll
186.article_body: The Janata Dal (United) has fielded Anil Hegde as its candidate for the Rajya Sabha by-elections in Bihar. The by-polls were necessitated due to the demise of sitting JD(U) MP Mahendra Prasad in December 2021. Hegde, originally from Karnataka's Mangaluru, has been residing in Patna and working on strengthening the party's organisation for decades now, a JD(U) leader said.

187.title: Kareena poses with West Bengal Police as she shoots for Sujoy Ghosh's next
187.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor has begun shooting for Sujoy Ghosh's 'The Devotion of Suspect X' in West Bengal's Kalimpong. Photos from Kareena's visit to a local family's house have surfaced on social media. In the photos, Kareena can be seen sitting with a group of women. She also met the West Bengal Police as they all posed for a picture.

188.title: Director Lokesh confirms Suriya's cameo in Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram'
188.article_body: Lokesh Kanagaraj, director of Kamal Haasan, Vijay Sethupathi and Fahadh Faasil-starrer 'Vikram', confirmed during an event that Suriya will make a cameo appearance in the upcoming film. Kamal, who was also present at the event, thanked Suriya for graciously accepting the offer, despite being asked to join the shoot at the last minute. 'Vikram' will release on June 3.

189.title: NHRC team visits Mundka fire site to probe human rights violations
189.article_body: A team of the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) visited the four-storey building in Delhi's Mundka where 27 people died in a massive fire on May 13. "It is the first day of the probe and it will progress as we get more facts," NHRC DG Sunil Meena said. The Commission took suo moto cognizance of the incident on Sunday.

190.title: Oppn parties have gone into overdrive against criticism: Pradhan
190.article_body: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan tweeted on Monday that "champions of free speech today are [the] real threat to freedom of expression and plurality." He said that Opposition parties have gone into an "overdrive" against criticism and that people like NCP chief Sharad Pawar and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal have taken it "too far". "Is their esteem so fragile?" he added.

191.title: Flight makes emergency landing in Mumbai as drunk man misbehaves with air hostess
191.article_body: A Doha-Bengaluru flight was forced to make an emergency landing in Mumbai on Saturday after a drunk passenger allegedly created ruckus on board. Police said Sarfuddin Ulwar allegedly misbehaved with an air hostess when she tried to stop him from drinking and also abused fellow passengers. Ulwar was arrested and booked under the Indian Penal Code and the Aircraft Act.

192.title: Blaming India won't solve problem: Chinese media as G7 criticises wheat export ban
192.article_body: China has reportedly come to India's defence after the Group of Seven (G7) industrialised nations criticised it for banning wheat exports. "Blaming India won't solve the food problem," said Global Times, a Chinese government outlet. "Why won't G7 nations themselves move to stabilise food market supply by hiking their exports?" the Global Times asked.

193.title: Sri Lanka reimposes nationwide curfew till Tuesday morning
193.article_body: Sri Lanka will reimpose a nationwide curfew which will be in effect from 8 pm on Monday to 5 am on Tuesday. The curfew was lifted on Sunday on the occasion of the Buddhist festival, Vesak. More than 200 people have been reportedly arrested on various grounds, including violating the curfew, amid protests over the economic crisis in the country.

194.title: Manushi receives 'Prithviraj' outfit as gift from makers on b'day, shares video
194.article_body: Manushi Chhillar, who turned 25 on May 14, was gifted an outfit she wore on the first day of the shoot of her debut film 'Prithviraj'. She took to Instagram to share an unboxing video with a caption that read, "What a start to my Birthday. Thank you YRF (Yash Raj Films) and Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi (film's director)."

195.title: FirstCry halts $1 bn IPO plans amid market volatility: Report
195.article_body: E-commerce unicorn FirstCry, which was to file its draft IPO papers in May, has delayed its planned $1 billion initial public offering (IPO) by a few months, the Economic Times reported. The kids' marketplace is reportedly reevaluating the pricing and issue size. This comes following a muted response to Delhivery's IPO last week amid broader market volatility, the report said.

196.title: Hope we get a charter plane back: Chirag Shetty to Air India's tweet on Thomas Cup win
196.article_body: Responding to Air India's congratulatory message on the Indian men's badminton team winning the Thomas Cup for the first time ever, shuttler Chirag Shetty wrote, "Hope we can get a charter plane back!" Air India had tweeted, "Congratulations to the Indian Men's Badminton Team...This victory will give wings to the dreams of all young sportspersons of our country."

197.title: 7 buffaloes killed, 15 injured by unidentified persons in Thane
197.article_body: Seven buffaloes were killed and 15 others were injured by some unidentified individual or persons in the Bhiwandi area of Thane, police said. "The motive may be professional rivalry. A case has been registered and efforts are on to arrest the culprits," a police officer said. The incident took place in a cattle shelter in Bunder Mohalla.

198.title: Best thing for Sweden's security is to join NATO: PM Andersson
198.article_body: Swedish PM Magdalena Andersson on Sunday said that joining NATO is the "best thing" for the security of the country and its people. This comes after Andersson's party Social Democrats announced that it will work towards applying for NATO membership amid the Russia-Ukraine war. "We believe Sweden needs the formal security guarantees that come with membership in NATO," she added.

199.title: Adani Group to buy 49% stake in Quintillion Business Media
199.article_body: Adani's AMG Media Networks will buy a 49% stake in Raghav Bahl-run platform Quintillion Business Media Ltd (QBML) for an undisclosed amount. It signed a Shareholders' Agreement with Quintillion Media Ltd (QML), QBML and a share purchase agreement with QML, QBML and Quint Digital Media Ltd (QDML). In March, Adani Group said it will acquire a minority stake in QBML.

200.title: Neha Sharma, Aisha Sharma to create show 'Shining with the Sharmas'
200.article_body: Actress Neha Sharma and her sister Aisha Sharma will be creating a short-format content show about their personal lives for a social media platform titled 'Shining with the Sharmas'. The show will reportedly be along the lines of American reality television show 'Keeping Up With The Kardashians'. The show will capture their lives at the gym, photoshoots and their downtime.

201.title: PM signs sketch of him & Lord Buddha made by a boy in Nepal, video surfaces
201.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday autographed a sketch of him and Lord Buddha reportedly made by a  boy in Nepal's Lumbini. A video showed PM Modi signing the sketch depicting him seeking the blessings of Lord Buddha, during the PM's meeting with the Indian community in Lumbini. The crowd is heard chanting 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai (Long Live Mother India)'.

202.title: US has made Pakistan a slave without invading it: Ex-PM Imran Khan
202.article_body: The US has made Pakistan a slave without invading it, Pakistan's ousted Prime Minister Imran Khan has claimed. "The people of Pakistan will never accept the imported government," he added. Khan, who was voted out of power last month through a no-confidence motion, has repeatedly alleged that his ouster was plotted by the US with the help of local players.

203.title: It won't be a bad idea to get him in: Parthiv on playing Dhull vs PBKS
203.article_body: Ahead of DC-PBKS in IPL 2022, Parthiv Patel said it won't be a bad idea to include 19-year-old Yash Dhull in DC's squad for their must-win match. He added that Dhull's mindset will be very positive and fresh as he has scored runs in Under-19 World Cup and Ranji Trophy. Both DC and PBKS have six wins each so far.

204.title: 'Liger' is a full-on masala film, it will make people really happy: Ananya
204.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday, speaking about her upcoming movie 'Liger', said that it is a "full-on masala film" and it will make people really happy. The film, scheduled to release in theatres on August 25, will also feature Vijay Deverakonda. Sharing her experience of working with Deverakonda, Ananya said, "Amazing...We had a lot of fun when we were shooting in USA."

205.title: Irrfan was perfect picture of Lord Shiva at Babil's birth: Sutapa Sikdar
205.article_body: Late actor Irrfan Khan's wife Sutapa Sikdar recently shared a series of throwback pictures of Babil on Instagram as he turned 24. In a picture, Irrfan is seen holding baby Babil. Alongside the post, Sutapa wrote, "The smile on Irrfan's face when he first saw you couldn't be recreated in a performance by Irrfan himself...Irrfan was...perfect picture of Lord Shiva."

206.title: Mumbai civic body plans dedicated areas for feeding stray dogs
206.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is planning to create dedicated areas for feeding stray dogs. "The designated places will help reduce conflict between people who feed dogs in open areas and other residents. The BMC will also speak with animal rights activists," said a BMC official. Finding dedicated areas may be difficult due to land constraint, some officials said.

207.title: Man stabs Delhi Jal Board worker over road rage, shot at by police
207.article_body: Police have arrested a man who allegedly stabbed a Delhi Jal Board (DJB) worker and threatened him with a pistol during a fight in Burari. Police said the victim was unloading construction material from his vehicle when the accused started fighting over space. The accused was arrested after police shot at him and overpowered him.

208.title: Banks to approach RBI to change definition of 'fraud': Report
208.article_body: Several banks will approach the Reserve Bank of India asking to change the definition of the word "fraud", according to a report. At present, all banks need to label a borrowing company as 'fraud account' if it has been marked by one lender. As per bankers, this often leads to legalities even after the amount is repaid by the borrower.

209.title: Shilpa Shetty reveals first look as superwoman Avni for 'Nikamma'
209.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty on Monday shared her first look in a superhero avatar as Avni for her upcoming film 'Nikamma' on social media. Her sister, actress Shamita Shetty commented on her post, writing, "Hotness personified!" Shilpa had earlier shared a blank picture with the caption, "Soooo bored of the monotony...going off social media till I find a new avatar."

210.title: US to hold first public hearing on UFOs since the 1960s tomorrow
210.article_body: A US Congress panel will on Tuesday (May 17) conduct a public hearing on reports of Unidentified Flying Objects (UFOs) for the first time since the 1960s. Lawmaker Andre Carson, who will oversee the hearing, said, "Someone has to do it...We all watch television, we've heard...(and) read things. We want to see the footage and have it explained to us."

211.title: We have been very impressed with Wriddhiman Saha: Gary Kirsten
211.article_body: GT batting coach Gary Kirsten has said it's great to have Wriddhiman Saha in their team in the ongoing IPL season. "We've been very impressed [with Saha]...He understands his game and plays really well in the powerplay," added Kirsten. So far, the 37-year-old has scored 281 runs in eight games. He scored 67* off 57 to help GT defeat CSK.

212.title: Dadagiri, gundagardi not okay: Kejriwal to MCD over demolition drive
212.article_body: Criticising the BJP-led MCD for its anti-encroachment drive in Delhi, CM Arvind Kejriwal said that doing dadagiri, gundagardi is not okay and added that he's told party members to stand by the people. Their plan is to break all unauthorised colonies in Delhi, where 50 lakh people stay and to destroy jhuggis, where 10 lakh people are living, he said.

213.title: Nigerian man wanders in semi-undressed state in B'luru; arrested
213.article_body: A 33-year-old Nigerian man who is a resident of Bengaluru's Hennur Cross was arrested after he was found wandering in a semi-undressed state, police said on Monday. The local people had informed the police after they reportedly got irked by the man's behaviour. The man had also allegedly assaulted police officers after they arrived at the spot and questioned him.

214.title: Pune's maximum temperature may rise to 40°C in next few days
214.article_body: The maximum temperature in Pune may rise to 40°C in the next few days, but not higher than that, an India Meteorological Department (IMD) official has said. He said that in the next few days, westerly winds will be getting stronger and cloudy weather will stay. The day temperature at Shivajinagar was 37.6°C on Sunday.

215.title: Rakhi Sawant receives BMW worth ₹40 lakh as gift, shares video
215.article_body: Rakhi Sawant received a BMW X1 worth ₹40 lakh as a gift from boyfriend Adil Khan Durrani and his sister hair and skin specialist Shelly Lather in April. She confirmed dating Adil in an interview with a journalist and shared it on Instagram. She had earlier said, "I'm not Salman Khan to be able to afford such a luxury car."

216.title: Ex-MLA, family members booked for conspiring to kill UP MLA
216.article_body: Former MLA Vijay Mishra, his wife, daughter and three others have been booked for allegedly conspiring to kill Vipul Dubey, the sitting legislator from UP's Gyanpur. Mishra, who won Gyanpur seat four times, lost to Dubey in the recently concluded Assembly polls. An FIR was registered after a video surfaced in which some people were heard plotting to kill Dubey.

217.title: Congress does not want to suppress tribals' history: Rahul Gandhi
217.article_body: The relationship between Congress and the tribals is very old and deep, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said in Rajasthan's Banswara. "We protect your history. We don't want to erase or suppress your history," Gandhi added while addressing a public rally. "During the UPA government, we had brought a historic law to protect your land, forest and water," Gandhi stated.

218.title: 80% Delhi illegal, will it all be destroyed?: Delhi CM on demolition drives
218.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday, while reacting to BJP-ruled civic bodies' anti-encroachment drives, said over 80% of the city can be considered built on encroached land. "Will 80% of Delhi be destroyed?" he asked. "We want to assure people that we will provide a solution to encroachment. We will regularise unauthorised colonies...We'll ensure they have proper sanitation," Kejriwal added.

219.title: I left Mumbai because of parents; felt like a stranger in the crowd: Lucky Ali
219.article_body: Singer Lucky Ali said he wanted to leave Mumbai after his father, actor Mehmood's demise and felt like he didn't belong there. He added that despite knowing a lot of people, he felt like a "stranger in the crowd". Lucky said the responsibilities of his parents took him to Bengaluru. "Mumbai is my maika...I'm Mumbai's Mai ka lal!" he added.

220.title: 2 UP men pose as share brokers, cheat Chandigarh firm of ₹3.66 cr
220.article_body: Two men from Ghaziabad, UP, have been booked for cheating a Manimajra-based firm, in Chandigarh, of ₹3.66 crore. The complainant, director of the firm in Manimajra, said he had met the accused in 2019 and they claimed to be SEBI registered share brokers. The complainant said that he had given the accused ₹3.66 crore to purchase shares.

221.title: Momoa criticised for pics in Vatican chapel, apologises & says 'I took permission'
221.article_body: 'Aquaman' actor Jason Momoa has apologised after being criticised for posing inside the Vatican City's Sistine Chapel and posting the pictures and videos on Instagram. Users had pointed out that photography is banned in the sacred space. "I was very respectful...I asked for permission for what I thought would be okay," said Momoa. He, however, didn't remove the pictures.

222.title: Steve Jobs wanted original iPhone to have no SIM card: iPod's creator
222.article_body: Apple's iPod creator Tony Fadell revealed that Apple Co-founder Steve Jobs wanted the first iPhone with no SIM card slot and wanted it to work on CDMA networks. "We don't want another hole in it (iPhone)," Jobs was quoted as saying by Fadell. "We had to give him data...to tell him that we need a SIM card slot," added Fadell.

223.title: Disappointed with my performance: Chahal on his bowling against LSG
223.article_body: Rajasthan Royals spinner Yuzvendra Chahal has said that he is a "little bit disappointed" with his bowling performance against the Lucknow Super Giants on Sunday. "I was a little bit disappointed with myself...The leg-side was shorter...So I didn't want to give any extra runs. That's why I tried to bowl a little bit quicker tonight," Chahal said.

224.title: Ex-BJP MLC BJ Puttaswamy appointed head seer of mutt in B'luru
224.article_body: Former BJP MLC BJ Puttaswamy has been appointed the head seer of the newly inaugurated Thaileswara Ganigara Mahasamsthana Mutt in Bengaluru. Former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa and BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi were among those present at the ceremony. Earlier this month, Puttaswamy had announced that he has taken 'sanyas'.

225.title: Heart issues, mountain sickness kill 39 since start of Char Dham Yatra
225.article_body: At least 39 people have died en route since the commencement of Char Dham Yatra in Uttarakhand, an official said on Monday. The official added that cardiac issues, high blood pressure and mountain sickness have been leading causes of death. Reports said that medically unfit people have been advised to not undertake the Yatra.

226.title: RBI may hike interest rates to pre-pandemic levels by Aug: SBI Research
226.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will inevitably hike interest rates in the upcoming monetary policy meetings and may take the rates up to pre-pandemic levels of 5.15% by August, according to a report by SBI Research. The report added that the rate hikes will be a result of biting inflation caused by the Russia-Ukraine war.

227.title: Andrew Symonds' sister leaves note on cricketer's accident site as tribute
227.article_body: Late Australia cricketer Andrew Symonds' sister Louise left a note on the cricketer's accident site as a tribute. "Gone far too soon! Rest in peace Andrew. I wish we had one more day, one more phone call. My heart is broken. I will always love you my brother," the note read. Symonds passed away in a car accident on Saturday.

228.title: Emergence of Shivling in Gyanvapi Mosque a 'pauranik' message: UP Dy CM
228.article_body: Soon after claims of a Shivling being found in Varanasi's Gyanvapi Mosque complex were reported, UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya took to Twitter to hail the incident. "The emergence of 'Baba Mahadev' [Lord Shiva] in Gyanvapi on the occasion of Buddha Purnima is a 'pauranik' [from ancient Hindu scriptures] message for the 'Sanatan' Hindu tradition," he said.

229.title: Union Minister Sitharaman visits Kalena Agrahara lake in Bengaluru
229.article_body: Union Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday visited Bengaluru's Kalena Agrahara lake, which was restored at a cost of ₹3 crore. The Bengaluru civic body has desilted the 7.3-acre lake and constructed a sewage diversion drain. A walkway and benches have also been set up for visitors and its storage capacity has been increased from 37.389 ML to 58.50 ML.

230.title: LIC shares trade at a discount in grey market ahead of listing: Reports
230.article_body: The shares of LIC were trading at a discount of ₹19 in the grey market on Monday, according to multiple reports. The ₹20,557 crore IPO of the state-run insurer, with the price band fixed at ₹902-949 per share, was oversubscribed nearly three times its issue size. The LIC shares will be listed on the stock exchanges on May 17.

231.title: Gang of 10 hacks panchayat chief to death in front of family in TN
231.article_body: A case was filed after a gang of 10 people allegedly hacked a panchayat president to death in front of his family in Tamil Nadu's Chennai on Sunday. The incident apparently occurred after a lorry, in which the accused were travelling, collided with the victim's car. The accused had reportedly beaten the man after he came out of the car.

232.title: Raghu Dixit to perform at Cannes, says 'Maybe we'll make French sing in Kannada'
232.article_body: Singer-songwriter Raghu Dixit will be performing at the upcoming 75th edition of the Cannes Film Festival. The singer said that he wants the crowd to have a great time and forget all their worries during his one-hour performance on May 21. "I want everyone to have a good time...Maybe we'll make the French sing in Kannada with us," said Raghu.

233.title: Kangana visits Tirupati Balaji temple ahead of Dhaakad release; shares pics
233.article_body: Actress Kangana recently visited Tirupati Balaji temple in Andhra Pradesh on the occasion of Buddha Purnima ahead of her film Dhaakad's release. Taking to Instagram, she shared pictures of her visit and wrote, "Today on this auspicious [Buddha] Purnima...'Dhaakad' producer, @deepakmukut ji, his wife...along with few more team members sought darshan at Tirupati Balaji."

234.title: Shang-Chi's Simu does bhangra on stage with Tesher, singer shares video
234.article_body: Canadian singer Hitesh Sharma, professionally known as Tesher, has shared a video where he and 'Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings' actor Simu Liu can be seen doing bhangra on stage at Juno Awards in Toronto. They danced to 'Jalebi Baby', a Punjabi-English song produced by Tesher. "Now that's how we celebrate...Asian heritage," Simu said after doing bhangra.

235.title: BJP's civic bodies will run bulldozers on properties of 63 lakh people: Delhi CM
235.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that BJP-ruled civic bodies will run bulldozers on the shops and houses of 63 lakh people in the capital. "This will be the biggest destruction in Independent India," he added. Further, Kejriwal asked to conduct elections for the civic bodies and added that the new MCD should decide on the encroachment issues.

236.title: Paytm to not acquire Raheja QBE; to apply for new general insurance license
236.article_body: Paytm's parent company One97 Communications has said that its proposed acquisition of Raheja QBE General Insurance Company Limited has been called off. It cited the reason, "As the share sale and purchase transaction hasn't...consummated within the time period envisaged by the parties under the...agreement." The company said it intended to apply for a new general insurance license.

237.title: Seal area where Shivling found in Gyanvapi Mosque: Varanasi court
237.article_body: A Varanasi court has ordered the District Magistrate to seal the area of the Gyanvapi Mosque where a Shivling has reportedly been found after its survey. The court prohibited the entry of any person to the area and added that the DM, Police Commissioner, Police Commissionerate and CRPF Commandant Varanasi will be responsible for the security of the sealed area.

238.title: I love Salman Khan, he was 1st to know when I had babies: Krushna
238.article_body: Comedian Krushna Abhishek said that he loves actor Salman Khan. "I love his heart. He wanted me to have kids. He would tell me, 'Kashmera, Krushna you should have babies now.' When I had babies, he was the first one to know," he added. Krushna also said that his sons were conceived on the 13th day after his father's death.

239.title: Charles Leclerc crashes Niki Lauda's 1974 £1-million Ferrari F1 car, video surfaces
239.article_body: Ferrari F1 team driver Charles Leclerc crashed three-time world champion Niki Lauda's 1974 £1-million Ferrari F1 car at the Historic Grand Prix of Monaco, which features some of motorsport’s most iconic vehicles. Leclerc lost control of the vehicle following a brake failure and crashed into a wall. Leclerc had also suffered a crash in Monaco during last year's qualifying race.

240.title: This is a do-or-die match for us: DC's Kuldeep Yadav on match vs PBKS
240.article_body: Ahead of their match against PBKS on Monday, DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav said they've prepared well for the game and will try not to repeat the mistakes they've committed so far in the ongoing IPL season. "This is a do-or-die situation for us," he added. Both DC and PBKS have 12 points from 12 games so far in the tournament.

241.title: China recalls its teachers from Pakistan after Karachi blast
241.article_body: China has reportedly recalled its teachers from Pakistan following the suicide blast in Karachi in which four people, including three Chinese, were killed. The Chinese teachers posted at the Confucius Institute of the University of Karachi left the country. The institutes will continue to run, for which help from Pakistani teachers has been sought.

242.title: Kim Jong-un criticises COVID-19 response as death toll rises to 50
242.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un on Sunday criticised officials for their "irresponsible work attitude" and lack of organisation over their response to the coronavirus outbreak, state-media KCNA reported. This comes as the number of deaths in the country rose to 50 amid the outbreak. Kim also ordered the military to help stabilise the drug supply in Pyongyang, the report said.

243.title: PM Modi, Nepal PM Deuba lay foundation stone of Buddhist Centre in Lumbini
243.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi along with his Nepalese counterpart Sher Bahadur Deuba on Monday laid the foundation stone for the construction of the India International Centre for Buddhist Culture and Heritage in the Lumbini Monastic Zone. The Centre will be constructed by the International Buddhist Confederation (IBC), New Delhi, on a plot allocated by the Lumbini Development Trust (LDT).

244.title: 2 killed at flea market in 3rd shooting incident in 2 days in US
244.article_body: Two people were killed and three others hospitalised after a shooting incident at a flea market in US' Texas on Sunday. All five were involved in an "altercation" that led to the shooting, a police official said. This is the third shooting incident reported in two days after 11 people were killed in separate incidents in California and New York.

245.title: I don't think people understand the emotions of a working mother: Anushka
245.article_body: Speaking about her life as a mother, actress Anushka Sharma said striking a work-life balance is "certainly harder" for women. She said, "I don't think people understand the life and emotions of a working mother because the world is...male-dominated." "Heck, I'm a woman, even I didn’t understand...till I became a mother. Today, I've so much more respect...for women," she added.

246.title: Ex-eBay workers plead guilty to harassing couple with spiders, funeral wreaths
246.article_body: As many as six former employees at eBay have pleaded guilty to harassing a couple, who ran an online newsletter and published several articles critiquing eBay in the US. They sent them live cockroaches, spiders, funeral wreaths, a bloodied pig mask and pornography. The six of them were charged in June 2020 while former CEO Devin Wenig was also sued.

247.title: Wriddhiman has been a real catalyst in GT's comfortable wins: Vettori
247.article_body: Ex-NZ captain Daniel Vettori has said Wriddhiman Saha has been a catalyst in GT's "comfortable wins" in IPL 2022. "Wriddhiman has [scored] enough runs in the powerplay to not put too much pressure on [other batters]...He's been a real catalyst...in going from just winning games to winning them comfortably," explained Vettori. GT defeated CSK by seven wickets on Sunday.

248.title: Ukraine says it destroyed 11 Russian aerial assets, stopped troops
248.article_body: The Ukrainian Air Force claimed that it destroyed 11 Russian aerial assets including two cruise missiles, two helicopters and seven unmanned aerial vehicles. It further claimed to have prevented the Russian troops from crossing the Inhulets river, according to a report. Earlier, the Ukraine military had prevented the Russian troops from crossing the Siverskyi Donets river in the Donetsk region.

249.title: Riots instigated by that party which benefits from it: Ashok Gehlot
249.article_body: Referring to the recent communal clashes across India including Rajasthan, State CM Ashok Gehlot has said that "riots are instigated by the party that benefits from it". "Is Congress benefitting from the riots? Everyone knows that wherever riots happen, the Congress will face the backlash," CM Gehlot said. He further demanded a probe by the Centre on the nationwide clashes.

250.title: Leaders of Bharatiya Kisan Union form separate 'apolitical' outfit
250.article_body: A section of the Bharatiya Kisan Union, which led the 13-month-long farmers' protest against the farm laws, formed a separate outfit on Sunday known as BKU (Apolitical). Announcing the new outfit on the death anniversary of BKU founder Chaudhary Mahendra Singh Tikait, the leaders of BKU (Apolitical) alleged they were upset with "political" statements made by BKU spokesperson Rakesh Tikait.

251.title: 81-year-old man arrested for 'digital rape' of 17-year-old girl for over 7 years in Noida
251.article_body: An 81-year-old man has been arrested in Noida for 'digital rape' of minor for over seven years. The man was living with the 17-year-old rape survivor as her guardian, police said. 'Digital rape' means forced sex using any object other than the reproductive organ. The incident came to light after the survivor shared her plight with a mutual contact.

252.title: Had turban styling expert, 50,000+ costumes were handmade: Prithviraj director
252.article_body: 'Prithviraj' director, Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi, said that 500 different turbans were created for the film and over 50,000 costumes were handmade by a costume designer who was flown from Rajasthan to Mumbai. "We had an expert on turban styling on the set who would oversee the process of these turbans being worn by our actors," he added.

253.title: 3 men pose as bank executives, cheat Ludhiana resident of ₹1 lakh
253.article_body: Three men, who posed as bank executives, were booked for cheating a Ludhiana resident of ₹1 lakh. The victim in his complaint said, "They (accused) asked me to download a mobile app and also took my credit and debit card details. Later, they withdrew ₹1 lakh from my account." The complainant took the bank's customer care number from the internet.

254.title: Ratna, Fatima, Dia & Sanjana to star in Taapsee's production 'Dhak Dhak'
254.article_body: Taapsee Pannu's production company Outsiders Films has collaborated with Viacom18 Studios for the film 'Dhak Dhak', which will feature Ratna Pathak Shah, Fatima Sana Shaikh, Dia Mirza and Sanjana Sanghi. Directed by Tarun Dudeja, it'll revolve around four women's life-changing journey to the highest motorable pass in the world. "I'm sure this ride will be an enriching one," Taapsee said.

255.title: India's final destiny is welfare of world: RSS leader Krishna Gopal
255.article_body: The welfare of the world is India's final destiny, RSS leader Krishna Gopal said. "We do not need anything lesser than this...Our thought and behaviour are inclusive. We are incomplete without everyone," Gopal added. The leader described Hindutva as "an epitome of global unity" while adding that it "does not divide humanity".

256.title: Bull hit after it comes in front of speeding motorcycle in UP, couple dies
256.article_body: A 35-year-old man and his 32-year-old wife were killed after the motorcycle they were travelling on hit a stray bull in Uttar Pradesh. Police said that the incident took place when the bull suddenly came in front of the speeding vehicle. The couple was rushed to community health centre where the doctors declared the two dead.

257.title: 117 people saved from suicide by Hyderabad's Lake Police in 2022
257.article_body: The officials of Hyderabad's Lake Police Station have rescued and counselled 117 people from attempting suicide since January 2022. According to the officials, most people were saved with the help of 220 cameras installed on the 9-km-long road across the lake. Notably, police officials roam in civil dress as well to prevent suicide near the Tank Bund, police said.

258.title: It was a challenging role for Kartik: Rajpal on 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'
258.article_body: Rajpal Yadav, who'll be seen sharing screen space with Kartik Aaryan in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', said that Kartik's performance in the film will touch the hearts of people. "It was a challenging role for Kartik but...he has done a fantastic job," he added. Rajpal further said Kartik's performance in the climax is one of the major highlights of the film.

259.title: Dhoni needs to take Gaikwad under his wing: Shaun Pollock
259.article_body: Ex-SA captain Shaun Pollock has said CSK will have to look for a captain outside their camp if MS Dhoni decides not to play in the next season. He added, "If [CSK management] goes to Ruturaj Gaikwad [for captaincy], you have to give Dhoni another year, and [Dhoni needs to] really take him under his wing."

260.title: Kashmiri Pandit employees to be posted at safer places: J&K L-G after Rahul Bhat's killing
260.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha has said that security would be increased in the residential areas of the government Kashmiri Pandit employees in the Valley. He added, "Posting for all of them would be done at safer places in the coming seven days (district centres and tehsil centres)." This comes after terrorists killed Rahul Bhat in his office.

261.title: Unbelievable: Leone as her fans organise blood donation drive on her b'day
261.article_body: Sunny Leone took to Instagram to thank her fans for organising a blood donation camp on her 41st birthday. She shared a picture of a news article, which mentioned that her fans in a Karnataka village "cut a cake, distributed food and conducted a camp that collected 39 units of blood" on her birthday. "This is unbelievable...I'll also...donate...blood," Leone wrote.

262.title: Karnataka govt's portal for online mango sales starts from today
262.article_body: The Karnataka government will start selling mangoes online through its own web portal for this year's mango season from today. The portal was launched in 2020 by the Karnataka State Mango Development and Marketing Corporation Limited in collaboration with the India Post. Notably, Karnataka cultivates the mango crop on 1.68 lakh hectares spread across 16 districts including Bengaluru Rural.

263.title: B'luru police tracks over 2,500 IP addresses to arrest man who stole a car via OLX ad
263.article_body: The Bengaluru police arrested a man three months after he allegedly stole an SUV on the pretext of taking it for a test drive. He stole the SUV on January 30, from an engineer who had posted an ad about it on OLX. While the accused used a stolen phone, the police tracked him after verifying over 2,500 IP addresses.

264.title: Will charge a bomb if I've to wear dhoti & walk in old Baburao style: Paresh
264.article_body: Speaking about what's actually needed to bring him on board if he has to play the role of 'Baburao' again in 'Hera Pheri' sequel, Paresh Rawal said, "If I've to wear...dhoti and walk in the same way with glasses...I'll charge a bomb!" "There's no excitement left in me for any of my characters unless it's put in...different backdrop," he added.

265.title: Thoughts of Lord Buddha can make our planet more harmonious: PM
265.article_body: On the occasion of Buddha Purnima, PM Narendra Modi on Monday said thoughts of Lord Buddha can make our planet more peaceful, harmonious and sustainable. "On Buddha Purnima, we recall the principles of Lord Buddha and reiterate our commitment to fulfil them," PM tweeted. PM Modi will be visiting Lumbini in Nepal on the occasion of Buddha Purnima on Monday.

266.title: 15-yr-old Pune girl waiting to cross road with aunt hit by a truck, dies
266.article_body: A 15-year-old girl was killed after she was hit by a truck while she was standing at a traffic signal to cross a road in Pune. The incident happened when the deceased girl was on way to her relative's place along with her aunt and cousin. Police said that the driver stopped the truck after hearing screams of people.

267.title: Full lunar eclipse creates rare super blood Moon in parts of world, pics surface
267.article_body: The first lunar eclipse of the year was visible from several countries in Americas, Europe and Africa. The eclipse coincided with a super Moon, which's when the Moon is at its closest point to Earth in its orbit. It created a super blood Moon as the Earth's natural satellite took on a reddish colour due to the Rayleigh scattering effect.

268.title: We will overcome, that's our determination: Sonia Gandhi
268.article_body: The Congress party will overcome, party chief Sonia Gandhi said in her concluding remarks at the 'chintan shivir' on Sunday. "We will overcome. That is our determination," Gandhi added. "Congress will have a new 'uday' (rising). That is our 'Nav Sankalp'," Gandhi stated. Gandhi also announced that the party will launch a 'National Kanniyakumari to Kashmir Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

269.title: Hate remains a stain on America's soul: Biden on Buffalo shooting
269.article_body: A day after 10 people were killed in New York's Buffalo shooting, US President Joe Biden said, "We must all work together to address the hate that remains a stain on the soul of America." Biden was speaking at the US Capitol in Washington at a memorial event for policemen killed in the line of duty.

270.title: PM Modi lands in Nepal, offers prayers at Maya Devi Temple with Nepal PM Deuba
270.article_body: PM Narendra Modi landed in Nepal on Monday and was received by Nepal PM Sher Bahadur Deuba on his arrival in Lumbini. PM Modi visited the Maya Devi Temple in Lumbini, where he and Nepal PM Deuba offered prayers. PM Modi tweeted, "Happy to be among the wonderful people of Nepal on the special occasion of Buddha Purnima."

271.title: Putin is 'very ill with blood cancer', Russian oligarch recorded saying: Report
271.article_body: An unnamed Russian oligarch was recorded saying that country’s President Vladimir Putin is "very ill with blood cancer". In a recording obtained by a US magazine New Lines, the unnamed oligarch was heard discussing Putin's health with a Western venture capitalist. The businessman also said that Putin underwent a surgery shortly before he ordered the invasion of Ukraine.

272.title: Ukrainians flood village on purpose to stop Russia's attack on capital Kyiv; pics surface
272.article_body: Ukrainian forces opened a dam early in the war in Demydiv, a small village north of Kyiv, causing the Irpin River to flood the village and thousands of acres around it. It created a quagmire and submerged cellars and fields but prevented a Russian attack on the capital. Two months later, people are still using inflatable boats to move around.

273.title: 4 NCP workers booked for slapping BJP leader at his Pune office
273.article_body: Pune police have registered a non-cognisable offence against four NCP workers for allegedly slapping BJP leader Vinayak Ambekar at his office in the city over a post against the former's party chief Sharad Pawar. This comes after a video of the incident had surfaced online. Ambekar had earlier filed a complaint claiming that about 20 NCP workers had attacked him.

274.title: You spend more time drinking coffee & eating cheese: UK PM on work from home
274.article_body: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson in an interview said that working from home doesn’t work. Johnson said, "My experience of working from home is you spend an awful lot of time making another cup of coffee and then...walking very slowly to the fridge, hacking off a small piece of cheese...and then forgetting what...you were doing."

275.title: Hasaranga is like a brother, happy if he takes wickets: Chahal on purple cap
275.article_body: Talking about the competition for the IPL 2022 purple cap, spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who's currently the highest wicket-taker, said he's happy with the success of other bowlers. "I'm happy for Wanindu Hasaranga because he's like a brother to me. If he takes wickets, if Kuldeep Yadav takes wickets, I'm happy with that," he stated. Hasaranga is currently the second-highest wicket-taker.

276.title: Hassan Sheikh Mohamud elected as new President of Somalia
276.article_body: Hassan Sheikh Mohamud has been elected as the new President of Somalia after defeating the incumbent Mohamed Abdullahi Mohamed in a runoff. Mohamud bagged 214 votes in the runoff, while his rival Mohamed was limited to 110. Mohamud was sworn in immediately after the result. This would be his second five-year term after his initial stint from 2012 to 2017.

277.title: Which bowlers have taken first-ball wicket on their IPL debut?
277.article_body: CSK's 19-year-old fast bowler Matheesha Pathirana on Sunday became the ninth bowler to take first-ball wicket on his IPL debut. Ishant Sharma was the first bowler to achieve the feat in IPL after he dismissed Rahul Dravid, while playing for KKR against RCB. In 2009, three bowlers managed to take a first-ball wicket on their IPL debut.

278.title: Been playing for 15 years, this setup at GT is really good: Wriddhiman Saha
278.article_body: GT opener Wriddhiman Saha, who was named 'Man of the Match' for his performance against CSK, said he sees himself as an aggressive player in the powerplay and the franchise is also letting him play freely. "I've been playing for 15 years now, but this setup...is really good," he added. GT are at the top of the IPL points table.

279.title: I look up to my father-in-law; he's very humble & grounded: Anup on Raj Babbar
279.article_body: Speaking about his father-in-law Raj Babbar, actor Anup Soni said, "I look up to him because he also came from a...humble background and reached great heights. He's still very humble and grounded." "I always maintain...he's the only actor from the National School of Drama who played a commercial hero. We...have brilliant actors...but Raj Babbar did it all," Anup said.

280.title: Wasn't a good idea to bat first: Dhoni after 7-wicket loss to GT
280.article_body: After losing to the Gujarat Titans by seven wickets, CSK skipper MS Dhoni has admitted that it wasn't a "good idea" to bat first in the match. "The fast bowler's ball wasn't coming on. That's why the batsmen found it tough...In the second half, it got slightly better...More runs in the middle overs would have been good," Dhoni said.

281.title: We screamed for help for 1.5 hrs, no one heard: Mundka fire survivor
281.article_body: One of the survivors of the Mundka fire incident, Shazia Parveen, said that she and other people trapped inside the building kept screaming for help for one-and-a-half hours but nobody heard them. "We also tried to break the glass to reach the terrace...but were unable to do so," Shazia said, adding that they weren't allowed to use phones at work.

282.title: Delhi Metro commuters using smart cards more than pre-COVID days
282.article_body: There has been a significant rise in the share of Delhi Metro commuters using smart cards this year as compared to pre-COVID days, according to DMRC. Since January 2022, about 78% of the commuters are using smart cards, up from around 70% before the pandemic. Notably, DMRC had temporarily stopped the token system when it resumed services in 2020.

283.title: World's most valuable company Saudi Aramco's profits surge by over 80% in Q1
283.article_body: Saudi Aramco has said that its profits jumped by more than 80% in the first three months of the year. The first-quarter earnings of the firm showed a record net income of $39.5 billion, up from $21.7 billion during the same period last year. Notably, Saudi Aramco overtook Apple as the world’s most valuable company last week.

284.title: Group stone pelts people swimming in H'yana canal, 5 feared drowned
284.article_body: Five people are feared drowned after an alleged rival group pelted stones at around 9-10 people who were swimming in the Yamuna canal in Haryana's Yamunanagar on Sunday, police said. "Out of fear, people went deeper and...people who didn't know how to swim, drowned," DSP (Yamunanagar-1) Subhash Chand said. The two groups had an enmity from 2020, he added.

285.title: Abdullah family engineered Kashmiri pandits' destruction: BJP leader
285.article_body: BJP's Tarun Chugh said National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah is trying to play dual politics after "destroying" the Hindus in J&K. Chugh in an official statement said the Abdullah family engineered the "destruction" of Kashmiri pandits' families in J&K for its political gains. "Abdullahji, shedding crocodile tears in the name of Kashmiri pandits is of no use," Chugh stated.

286.title: Man attacks woman lawyer in Karnataka, kicks and slaps her in public; video surfaces
286.article_body: A woman lawyer was kicked and slapped repeatedly by her neighbour in Bagalkote district of Karnataka on Saturday. A video of the incident showing the man attacking the lawyer in public and no one coming to her rescue has gone viral on social media. According to police, he attacked the lawyer due to personal enmity regarding a civil dispute case.

287.title: Influencer raises ₹1.8 cr for Uber driver who helped her after she was robbed in US
287.article_body: A social media influencer raised over $2,40,000 (approximately ₹1.8 crore) via crowdfunding for an Uber driver after he helped her when she got robbed in California. The driver had helped her find her phone and credit card which were robbed during Coachella. The driver had revealed to her that his daughter was diagnosed with cancer, following which she started crowdfunding.

288.title: Speaking on movie more important for PM than Kashmiri Pandits genocide: Rahul
288.article_body: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has alleged that "it is more important for the Prime Minister to speak on a film than on the genocide of Kashmiri Pandits". "Terror is at its peak in Kashmir today due to the policies of BJP. Prime Minister, take the responsibility of security and try to bring peace," Gandhi tweeted.

289.title: Devotees rush to get coconut prasad at MP event, 17 injured in stampede
289.article_body: A stampede took place at a religious event in Madhya Pradesh's Bina when devotees rushed to receive the coconut prasad that was being distributed. Seventeen people were injured during the incident that took place at Bageshwar Dham temple at Khimlasa Road. An official said that there were around 25,000 people at the event when the incident took place.

290.title: Mundka fire victims' families give DNA samples to identify bodies
290.article_body: The family members of 24 of the 27 victims who died in Delhi's Mundka fire submitted their DNA samples to help identify the charred bodies found on the site, said police. The samples, submitted at Sanjay Gandhi Memorial Hospital, will be studied by forensic experts. The bodies of eight victims have been identified so far.

291.title: Folk singer Yogesh Gadhvi uses casteist slur at public event in Guj, booked
291.article_body: Police have booked folk and devotional singer Yogesh Gadhvi, also known as Yogesh Boxa, for allegedly using casteist slur against the Dalit community during his performance at a public event in Gujarat. Reports said that Yogesh was performing at the inauguration ceremony of a girl students' hostel in Radhakrishna Nagar. BJP state President CR Paatil was also present at event.

292.title: Centre not consulting states on national policies: Maharashtra Minister
292.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Subhash Desai has accused the Centre of not consulting states "while drafting new policies of national significance". "It must hear the views of the states. The dialogue that is needed between the two is not happening," Desai said. "If you take our views, we are not going to mislead you. We may protect our state's interest," he added.

293.title: Andrew Symonds' dogs survived car accident, one didn't leave his side: Eyewitness
293.article_body: Andrew Symonds' two blue heeler dogs survived the car accident which took the former Australia all-rounder's life. "One of them was very sensitive and didn't want to leave him. It would just growl at [us] every time we tried to move him or go near him," an eyewitness said. The forensic crash unit is investigating the accident.

294.title: Jet fuel prices hiked by 5% to climb new record high in Delhi
294.article_body: Prices of aviation turbine fuel (ATF) have been hiked by 5% to reach a record-high of ₹1,23,039.71 per kilolitre (₹123.03 per litre) in Delhi, as per a price notification of state-owned fuel retailers. Jet fuel makes up 40% of the running cost of an airline and ATF prices have been hiked every fortnight since the beginning of 2022.

295.title: Vicky Kaushal's father shares throwback pic on son's 34th birthday
295.article_body: Vicky Kaushal's father, action director Sham Kaushal, took to Instagram on Monday to wish the actor on his 34th birthday. He shared a collage featuring Vicky's childhood picture, and wrote, "Wish you a very Happy Birthday Puttar. Always love and blessings...Feeling blessed and proud to have a son like you." Vicky's brother Sunny Kaushal also wished him on his birthday.

296.title: Matheesha Pathirana is an excellent death bowler: MS Dhoni
296.article_body: Praising 19-year-old Sri Lankan bowler Matheesha Pathirana, who made his debut for CSK against GT on Sunday, captain MS Dhoni said, "He is an excellent death bowler." Dhoni added, "A bit similar to Malinga...With a slingy action, Pathirana doesn't get a lot of bounce. He has got that slower one as well." Pathirana registered figures of 3.1-0-24-2 on debut.

297.title: Will legally reclaim all temples demolished by Mughals: Eshwarappa
297.article_body: BJP leader KS Eshwarappa on Sunday said all the temples demolished by Mughals should be reclaimed "legally". "In this country, 36,000 temples have been demolished by the Mughals from those times itself," Eshwarappa added. "Everyday news is coming out. Through the courts, without a fight or struggle, on the basis of the verdict, we will reclaim these temples," he stated.

298.title: Rahul to contest 2024 polls, he will rule the country: DK Shivakumar
298.article_body: Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi will contest the 2024 Lok Sabha elections and he will "rule the country". "We all are confident that Congress will come back under Rahul Gandhi's leadership...G23 has gone, the entire party is united and we all are one (on G23 push for the parliamentary board)," Shivakumar added.

299.title: India reports 2,202 new COVID-19 cases, 27 deaths in last 24 hours
299.article_body: India has reported 2,202 COVID-19 cases, 2,550 recoveries and 27 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,487 COVID-19 cases and 13 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 17,317, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,241.

300.title: IAF rescues 119 train passengers stranded in Assam due to heavy rain
300.article_body: The Indian Air Force helicopters rescued 119 passengers from Assam's Ditokchera railway station. While sharing pictures on social media, the Indian Air Force said that the train had been stranded at the railway station for over 24 hours due to incessant rains. Earlier, three people had lost their lives as rains had triggered landslides in parts of Dima Hasao district.

301.title: Moneylender extorts Pune couple despite getting repaid; 3 arrested
301.article_body: Three persons were arrested in connection with an extortion case in which a moneylender allegedly forced a Pune couple to pay him even after the loan was repaid. The complainant said they had borrowed ₹2 lakh and repaid around ₹12.24 lakh at 40% interest but the moneylender still forced them to sign property papers and grabbed their flat.

302.title: Up to 90% of our team will permanently work from home: Zerodha CEO
302.article_body: Zerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath has said that 85-90% of his employees will permanently work from home. "People are enjoying living in their small towns. Belagavi has amazing talent and we have a large team working there. Folks are enjoying Belagavi...having maids and independent houses which they could never think of affording in Bengaluru," he said.

303.title: Met actors who show off; I manage with them: Panchayat 2 actor Raghubir
303.article_body: When asked how's it working with the new generation of actors, 'Panchayat' season 2 actor Raghubir Yadav said, "I never treat them as new actors because the work that we take up is new to us. I learn...from them. I try to become young with them." "I've met many actors who show off. I manage with such actors," he added.

304.title: Motivational speaker called to address employees among dead in Mundka fire
304.article_body: A 62-year-old motivational speaker, Kailash Jyani, who was called to address the employees of a commercial unit in Mundka was among those who died in the fire that broke out at a building near the Mundka metro station. His 37-year-old son who was accompanying him to venue also died in the incident. Fire broke out in building on May 13.

305.title: Sewage flows into Bengaluru's Haralur Lake, dead fish seen: Report
305.article_body: The condition of Bengaluru's Haralur Lake is deteriorating due to constant flow of sewage, following which dead fish were also seen in the waterbody last week, The Indian Express reported. "Death of fish is an indicator that...water quality isn't conducive," a lake conservationist said. The sewage flow is because BWSSB is "yet to lay...sanitary pipelines", a BBMP superintendent engineer claimed.

306.title: 4 Pune pub owners booked over operating past midnight, serving hookah
306.article_body: Pune police have booked the owners and managers of three pubs and bars for allegedly operating past midnight and one another for serving hookah to customers. During a raid on the pub serving hookah, the police also seized hookah pots, flavoured tobacco material and phones worth a total of about ₹89,600. Serving hookah was banned in Maharashtra in 2018.

307.title: Another mass shooting in US, 1 killed, 5 injured in California church attack
307.article_body: One person was killed, four were critically wounded and another person sustained minor injuries after a man opened fire at a California church. The gunman was "hogtied" by parishioners after the incident. The suspect, an Asian man in his 60s, was detained and two handguns were recovered. This comes after an 18-year-old man shot dead 10 people in New York.

308.title: SBI hikes lending rate by 10 bps; 2nd such hike in 2 months
308.article_body: State Bank of India has hiked the marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 10 basis points, or 0.1%, across tenures with effect from May 15. Notably, this is SBI's second hike in MCLR in two months. An increase in MCLR will lead to a rise in EMIs for those who have availed home, vehicle and personal loans.

309.title: Once again the batting group wasn't able to perform collectively: Rahul
309.article_body: After their second straight defeat in the ongoing IPL season, LSG captain KL Rahul said, "Once again the batting group [wasn't] able to perform collectively." He added, "We have lost three-four games in the powerplay as a batting unit." Chasing RR's 178-run total, LSG scored 154/8 in 20 overs and suffered their fifth defeat in 13 games.

310.title: Fraudsters using fake UPI payment screenshots to cheat in Pune
310.article_body: Several cases of cheating by fraudsters who show fake UPI payment screenshots to cheat businessmen have been reported in Pune. The cyber crime police station recorded as many as 379 cheating complaints related to UPI-based platforms between January and April. In many instances, jewellers were cheated of large sums of money by frauds using fake payment screenshots.

311.title: Trolls call Amitabh Bachchan 'buddhe', accuse him of drinking desi liquor; he responds
311.article_body: A section of Facebook users trolled Amitabh Bachchan for his post on Sunday, wherein he wished his followers Good Morning at 11.26 am. A troll commented, "Abbey Buddhe, dopahar ho gayi hai," to which Amitabh wrote, "I pray to god...nobody insults you when you grow old." Another accused him of drinking desi liquor, with Amitabh responding that he doesn't drink.

312.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read with just 7 matches remaining?
312.article_body: With just seven matches remaining in IPL 2022 league stage, GT are the only team to have qualified for playoffs. They're assured of a top-two finish. Following their win against LSG, RR are now second on the table, followed by LSG. RCB (14 points), DC (12), KKR (12), PBKS (12) and SRH (10) are also in contention for playoffs spots.

313.title: He was someone I could call at 2:30 am and say 'Let's meet': Harbhajan on Symonds
313.article_body: Talking about his late MI teammate Andrew Symonds, Harbhajan Singh said, "We used to sit together, have a drink, laugh, share a lot of stories." He added, "He was someone I could call at 2:30 in the morning and say 'Hey mate, what are you doing? What are you up to? Let's meet' and he'd be up for it."

314.title: 10-yr-old Hyd boy enters swimming pool without safety tube, drowns
314.article_body: A 10-year-old boy drowned to death after he entered a swimming pool without safety tube in Hyderabad. The boy's aunt said that the management of the swimming pool did not have safety tubes. "There was no one...when he was drowning. We started shouting when we saw Manoj in the pool. The management people came after 10 minutes," his aunt added.

315.title: Adani to become India's 2nd biggest cement maker with $10.5 bn Holcim deal
315.article_body: Adani Group on Sunday acquired Holcim's stake in Ambuja Cements and ACC in a $10.5 billion deal, making it the second-biggest cement producer in India. Ambuja and ACC have a combined capacity to produce at least 70 million tonnes of cement annually, second to UltraTech Cement's  120 million tonnes capacity. This will also be the largest-ever acquisition for Adani Group.

316.title: RR defeat LSG by 24 runs, move to 2nd position on IPL 2022 points table
316.article_body: RR defeated LSG by 24 runs at Brabourne Stadium in Mumbai to move to the second position on the IPL 2022 points table. RR and LSG have 16 points each, with RR having a superior net run-rate (NRR). RR put up a total of 178/6 with Yashasvi Jaiswal top-scoring with 41(29). LSG were restricted to 154/8 in their 20 overs.

317.title: NATO expects Turkey not to oppose membership of Finland, Sweden
317.article_body: NATO and the US on Sunday said that they expect Turkey not to oppose the membership of Finland and Sweden into the Western military alliance. Notably, Turkey had said that it had reservations about Finnish and Swedish membership. Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan had claimed that the Nordic countries were home to many "terrorist organisations".

318.title: Sweden to apply for NATO membership amid Ukraine war, ruling party confirms
318.article_body: Sweden's ruling Social Democrats party on Sunday said it will work toward the country applying for membership in the military alliance NATO. This came after Finland said it will seek membership in the alliance amid the Russia-Ukraine war. The party, however, said it was opposed to stationing nuclear weapons or permanent NATO military bases in Sweden.

319.title: Symonds' demise is big loss to cricketing fraternity as a whole: Lalchand
319.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Lalchand Rajput has said former Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds' demise is a "big loss" not only to Australian cricket but the cricketing fraternity as a whole. "If you look at his career, he was a versatile player...adopted all the formats...he was a match-winner," he added. Symonds passed away, aged 46, in a car accident.

320.title: UN report lists US, Pakistan among 23 drought-hit countries
320.article_body: Pakistan is among the 23 countries that have faced drought emergencies over the past two years, according to a UN report. Iran, Iraq, the US and Afghanistan are among the 22 other countries also facing a similar situation. Separately, the report estimated that an additional 4 million square kilometres of natural areas would require drought restoration measures by 2050.

321.title: Good move: Musk on Netflix telling staff 'If you don't like our content, you can quit'
321.article_body: Elon Musk tweeted, "Good move by Netflix", in response to an article about Netflix asking its employees to quit if they don't like the company's content. Netflix recently updated its culture guidelines to add an "Artistic Expression" section. Under it, Netflix says, "If you'd find it hard to support our content breadth...Netflix may not be the best place for you."

322.title: Probably GT weren't given enough credit after their first few games: Vettori
322.article_body: Discussing table-toppers GT's performance in ongoing IPL, Daniel Vettori said the debutants weren't given enough credit after their first few matches as they were close and could have gone either way. "But someone like Rahul Tewatia, David Miller or Rashid Khan got them over the line," he added. GT are the first team to qualify for the playoffs.

323.title: 3 more cases against Ketaki for allegedly insulting Sharad Pawar on Facebook
323.article_body: Three more cases have been registered against Marathi actress Ketaki Chitale for allegedly sharing a 'derogatory' Facebook post on NCP chief Sharad Pawar. Two of the fresh cases were registered in Mumbai and one in the Akola district of Maharashtra. She was arrested by Thane Crime Branch on Saturday and a court remanded her in police custody till May 18.

324.title: Can't walk on road even for a few secs: 10-yr-old activist Licypriya as Delhi hits 49°C
324.article_body: As maximum temperatures in Delhi crossed 49 degrees Celsius on Sunday, 10-year-old climate activist Licypriya Kangujam said, "Temperatures are [higher] on the ground than (in) the air." She said, "When I go out shopping in the afternoon, I can't walk for even a few seconds on the road...It's difficult to breathe the air. Very dangerous for kids."

325.title: Sedition law, UAPA abused in last 7 yrs to finish opponents: Raut
325.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Sunday said that the sedition law, prevention of Money Laundering Act and Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act have been abused widely in the last seven years "to finish political opponents". The PMLA will go the same way as sedition law, which has been stayed by the Supreme Court, added Raut.

326.title: VP Naidu visits UAE to offer condolences over death of Sheikh Khalifa
326.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Sunday arrived in the UAE to offer his condolences following the demise of the country's late ruler Sheikh Khalifa Bin Zayed Al Nahyan. Naidu offered his condolences to new President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan and UAE's entire leadership. Several leaders from across the world are visiting the country to pay their respects.

327.title: Novak Djokovic wins Italian Open, clinches his record-extending 38th Masters 1000 title
327.article_body: Novak Djokovic defeated Stefanos Tsitsipas 6-0, 7-6(7-5) in the final of the Italian Open on Sunday to clinch a record-extending 38th ATP Masters 1000 title. It is Djokovic's first title victory of the year. The Serbian had become the fifth man in the Open Era to earn 1,000 singles match wins when he defeated Casper Ruud in the semi-finals.

328.title: 50-yr-old grocery store owner killed by 3 with sticks over ₹30 in UP
328.article_body: Three people allegedly thrashed a 50-year-old grocery store owner to death for demanding ₹30, which they had borrowed from him, police said on Sunday. The incident took place on Saturday night when the accused attacked the shopkeeper Yashpal, with sticks for demanding  ₹30, which he had lent them earlier, Additional Superintendent of Police (Rural) Ram Arj said.

329.title: Rebels killed 7,000 civilians in Ethiopia's Amhara in 2021: Govt
329.article_body: Nearly 7,000 civilians were killed by the Tigrayan rebels in Ethiopia's Amhara region between June and December last year, according to a report commissioned by the regional government. The study also documents that several mass graves were found at sites throughout the region. However, the rebels have rejected the findings of the report.

330.title: Adani to buy Holcim's stake in Ambuja Cements and ACC for $10.5 billion
330.article_body: Adani Group on Sunday announced that it will acquire Holcim's stake in Ambuja Cements and ACC. The value for Holcim's stake and open offer consideration is about $10.5 billion. It will be the largest-ever acquisition for Adani Group and the largest-ever transaction in India's infrastructure and materials space. Switzerland-based Holcim holds 63.19% stake in Ambuja Cements and 54.53% in ACC.

331.title: He sat there like an a**hole: Wanda on Will slapping Chris at Oscars
331.article_body: Actress-comedienne Wanda Sykes has spoken about the 2022 Oscars slap incident, saying she is "still traumatised". Actor Will Smith slapped comedian Chris Rock onstage after the latter made a joke about his wife Jada Pinkett Smith. Wanda added, "I couldn't believe [Will] was still sitting there, like an a**hole. Shouldn't you be sitting there with a lawyer or LAPD, motherf*cker?"

332.title: Kochi Police deny permission to use loudspeakers at Bob Marley event
332.article_body: Fort Kochi Police denied permission to use loudspeakers for a cultural programme commemorating singer Bob Marley citing law and order issues. Programme convenor Rasheed Mattanchery said that the permission for the programme was denied by the police and they plan to go ahead with the event with 'necessary changes' to the programme titled 'Bob Marley-Songs and Strife'.

333.title: Bride injured as mass wedding stage collapses due to wind in Maha
333.article_body: A mass wedding pandal, where 125 couples were to tie the knot, collapsed due to gusty winds in Maharastra's Palghar on Sunday, injuring a bride and three others. People started running out of the pandal and it led to a commotion. The injured persons were given first aid and the event was later shifted to an adjacent pandal.

334.title: Director Avinash booked for sharing pic of Amit Shah with arrested IAS officer
334.article_body: 'Anaarkali of Aarah' director Avinash Das has been booked for allegedly sharing a picture of Union Home Minister Amit Shah with IAS officer Pooja Singhal. The Jharkhand IAS officer was arrested in a money laundering case. A case was filed against Das by Ahmedabad Police who said he allegedly tried to "mislead the people and defame the reputation of Shah".

335.title: Ajay Devgn-starrer 'Raid' to be remade in Telugu: Report
335.article_body: Ajay Devgn's 2018 film 'Raid' will reportedly be remade in Telugu. Harish Shankar will reportedly direct the film. "Harish Shankar recently visited Mumbai to lock a few things related to...Telugu version," a source was quoted by Pinkvilla. "The makers are currently looking out for the lead actor who can fill in Ajay's shoes in the Telugu version," the source added.

336.title: India's 1st-ever Thomas Cup win is a great achievement: Srikanth's father
336.article_body: Shuttler Kidambi Srikanth's father Krishna lauded the Indian badminton team following their first-ever Thomas Cup title win in Bangkok, saying it's a great achievement for all the Indians. "It's a very happy moment that India has achieved...Thomas Cup after such a long period," he added. Notably, Srikanth remained undefeated throughout the tournament. India beat Indonesia 3-0 in final on Sunday.

337.title: Rajamouli's 'RRR' to re-release in US on June 1 for one-night event
337.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' starring Ram Charan and Jr NTR will be re-releasing in US for a one-night event. Rajamouli said, "America has embraced 'RRR' as its own and crossing borders, the love that the American audience has shown our film has been gratifying." 'RRR' is the second-highest grossing Indian film in US after Rajamouli's Prabhas-starrer 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion'.

338.title: Raghav Juyal joins cast of Salman Khan's 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'
338.article_body: Dancer and actor Raghav Juyal will be a part of Salman Khan's upcoming film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'. "I'm playing a pivotal role along with Pooja Hegde, Aayush Sharma and Zaheer Iqbal which is directed by Farhad Samji," Raghav said in a statement. Reportedly, the film also features former Bigg Boss contestant Shehnaaz Gill.

339.title: Behind every successful man there's a woman, we should have a Wife's Day: Athawale
339.article_body: Ramdas Athawale, MoS for Social Justice and Empowerment, on Sunday demanded that a "Wife's Day" be celebrated along the lines of Mother's Day. "Behind every successful man, there's a woman...We should celebrate Wife's Day," Athawale said. "A mother gives birth while a wife stands by her husband in good and bad times," he added.

340.title: Sadly this isn't the 1st such case: India condemns killing of 2 Sikhs in Pak
340.article_body: India on Sunday condemned the killing of two Sikh businessmen in Pakistan's Peshawar and called upon the concerned authorities to take "strict action against those responsible for this deplorable incident". The Ministry of External Affairs said, "Sadly, this is not the first such case or a rare occurrence...We have registered our strong protest with the Government of Pakistan."

341.title: IIFA postponed following UAE President’s demise, to be held in July
341.article_body: International Indian Film Academy 2022 (IIFA) has been postponed following UAE President Sheikh Khalifa Bin Zayed Al Nahyan's demise. The event was slated to be held in May, but now will be held from July 14 to July 16 due to the 40-day mourning period in the UAE. IIFA will be hosted by Salman Khan, Ritesh Deshmukh and Maniesh Paul.

342.title: AR Rahman's debut film 'Le Musk' to premiere at Cannes Film Festival
342.article_body: Music composer AR Rahman's debut directorial venture 'Le Musk' will be premiering at the Cannes Film Market's Cannes XR programme. "'Le Musk' has been several years in the making with collaborators worldwide. We've aimed to create an unprecedented, subtle sensory cinematic surrealism," Rahman said. He composed the film's background score and adapted it from a screenplay by Gurachi Phoenix.

343.title: India added 8.8 million jobs in April 2022: CMIE report
343.article_body: Indian labour markets saw substantially increased activity during April 2022 as the labour force increased by 8.8 million from 428.4 million in March to 437.2 million in April, according to a Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) report. "This is one of the largest monthly increases in the labour force if we exclude the lockdown impacted months," the report added.

344.title: Have decided to be in UK with family for few months & not work: Purab
344.article_body: Actor Purab Kohli said he is in London with his family after finishing the shoot of his upcoming project in Mumbai. Purab further added that he'll take a break from acting for a few months to be with his family. "I am very happy (taking a break). I'd like to spend a lot of time at home also," he added.

345.title: World no. 1 Swiatek defends Italian Open title with 28th straight win
345.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek defeated Madrid Open champion Ons Jabeur 6-2, 6-2 to successfully defend her Italian Open title on Sunday, clinching her fifth straight title. Swiatek, who didn't drop a set in Rome, extended her winning streak to 28 matches. Swiatek has won every WTA 1000 she has contested this season, winning Doha, Indian Wells and Miami before.

346.title: Ukraine has deployed American M-777 howitzers at front lines: US
346.article_body: The US embassy in Kyiv on Sunday tweeted that Ukraine has deployed many of the newly supplied American M-777 howitzers at the front lines. The howitzers were delivered as part of the "$800 million care package for the Ukrainian Armed Forces", it said. "All but one of the 90 Howitzers sent by the US are now in Ukraine," it added.

347.title: No joy for me apart from money: Paresh Rawal on 'Hera Pheri' sequel
347.article_body: Veteran actor Paresh Rawal, on being asked about doing a sequel of 'Hera Pheri' or 'Andaz Apna Apna', said that "other than money", it will have no joy for him. "If we are coming up with a sequel...with the same old ghisa-pita jokes, it will not work. It should evolve and only then I'll be excited about it," he added.

348.title: This win is precious: Lakshya's mother on India's maiden Thomas Cup win
348.article_body: Terming the Indian men's badminton team's first-ever Thomas Cup win "very precious", shuttler Lakshya Sen's mother Nirmala said, "We're feeling so happy and proud. We congratulate the entire Indian team." She added, "We were watching the match. We'll celebrate the win with Lakshya via video conference and cut the cake." India defeated 14-time champions Indonesia 3-0 in their maiden final.

349.title: Thousands take part in protests against President Saied in Tunisia
349.article_body: Thousands of people took to the streets in Tunisia on Sunday to protest against Tunisian President Kais Saied, demanding a return to the normal democratic order. The protesters chanted "The people want democracy" and "Saied has led the country to starvation" at the main rally in central Tunis. Saied had seized executive power and dismissed the Parliament last summer.

350.title: He was so beautiful it was inhuman: Jennifer on engagement with Depp
350.article_body: Johnny Depp's ex-fiancee Jennifer Grey recalled her nine-month engagement with the actor in the late 1980s. "You have to understand...1989 Johnny Depp, [was] so beautiful, you've never seen a more beautiful...it's almost inhuman," she stated. Earlier, Grey had said that she does not recognise Depp from the clips of the defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard.

351.title: Earlier I felt bad people knew my character's name, not mine: Pankaj
351.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi has revealed in an interview that he would earlier feel bad when people would recognise him by his characters' names and not his own. "I would always wish they knew my name. And today, everyone knows my name but they love my characters so much that they deliberately call me by those names," the actor added.

352.title: Sidharth Malhotra shares pic of injury from 'Indian Police Force' set
352.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra on Sunday shared a selfie with filmmaker Rohit Shetty which showed his injured forearm from the sets of 'Indian Police Force'.
