He wrote alongside the picture, "#RohitShetty action hero equals to real sweat, real blood! Rohit sir working the camera for some crazy action sequences in Goa." Rohit also shared a behind-the-scenes picture from the Goa shoot.

353.title: AAP announces alliance with Twenty20 Party in Kerala
353.article_body: AAP national convener and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday announced an alliance with Twenty20 Party in Kerala ahead of Thrikkakara bypoll. The alliance has been named People's Welfare Alliance (PWA). Kejriwal also announced free electricity to the people of the state if elected to power and said generator shops in Delhi have been shut due to round-the-clock power supply.

354.title: List of Indian cities with highest maximum temperatures today released
354.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has released a list of cities that recorded maximum temperatures of over 45 degrees Celsius amid a prevailing heatwave in parts of India. Cities in eight states namely Rajasthan, UP, MP, Punjab, Bihar, Haryana, Maharashtra (Vidarbha) and Jharkhand featured on the list. Delhi also featured on the list as temperatures there breached 47 degrees Celsius.

355.title: BJP turning demographic dividend into demographic disaster: Rahul
355.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday said that the BJP is hell-bent on turning demographic dividend into a demographic disaster. "Congress has always provided a platform for people to deliberate without fear, worry," he said. "Meaningful conversations are not allowed in India nowadays. We see conversations being muzzled and we do not understand its consequences," he added.

356.title: Actress Pallavi Dey found dead at her flat in Kolkata, family alleges murder
356.article_body: Bengali TV actress Pallavi Dey was on Sunday found dead at her rented apartment in Kolkata's Garfa area, the police said. As per a preliminary investigation, the actress, who was in her 20s, is suspected to have died by suicide, police said. Her family, however, alleged that she may have been murdered. Her live-in boyfriend is being questioned.

357.title: Shabana pens note on Shyam Benegal's 'advertising acumen' at Cannes
357.article_body: Veteran actress Shabana Azmi on Saturday took to Instagram to share a picture of herself along with late actress Smita Patil and veteran director Shyam Benegal from Cannes 1976. They were there to promote 'Nishant'. She wrote, "We had no publicity material...Shyam...asked Smita...and me to...walk up and down the promenade to attract attention...That was the advertising acumen of #Shyam Benegal."

358.title: Asia's richest man Adani nears $10 bn deal for Holcim's India business: Report
358.article_body: Asia's richest man Gautam Adani is nearing a deal to buy Swiss building material company Holcim's India business, Bloomberg reported. Adani Group will pay $10 billion for 63.1% of Ambuja Cements Ltd, currently held by Holcim, along with its related assets. The deal is expected to make Adani Group a sizeable player in the cement sector, the report added.

359.title: Movie industry workers arrested by officials in Iran: Filmmaker
359.article_body: Mohammad Rasoulof, an award-winning Iranian filmmaker, said that Iranian security forces raided offices and homes of several filmmakers and other industry professionals and arrested some of them. In a statement signed by dozens of movie industry professionals, Rasoulof claimed that some film production equipment was confiscated. The statement condemned the raids and called them "illegal".

360.title: Groom in UP puts wedding on hold until cousin's release from jail
360.article_body: A groom in UP halted his wedding to save his cousin (Ankit), who was imprisoned after a fight with the bride's relatives during a pre-wedding ceremony. Didauli SHO Suneel Malik said that the bride's father filed a complaint against Ankit. "We are helpless as the legal procedure has to be followed before Ankit can be released," said the SHO.

361.title: India's Thomas Cup win is like winning cricket WC in 1983: Dinesh Khanna
361.article_body: Following Indian men's badminton team's maiden Thomas Cup win after defeating 14-time champions Indonesia 3-0 in final on Sunday, ex-Asian badminton champion Dinesh Khanna congratulated them, saying, "It's like winning...World Cup in cricket for the first time in 1983." He added, "There's nothing more greater than this win, as far as team championship for men in the sport is concerned."

362.title: Historic feat for Indian badminton: Kohli on India's maiden Thomas Cup win
362.article_body: Congratulating Indian men's badminton team after their first-ever Thomas Cup win, Virat Kohli took to Twitter and wrote, "A historic achievement and a massive moment for Indian badminton." Abhinav Bindra tweeted, "An incredible achievement by an incredible Team India...bounced back from tough situations on numerous occasions to win gold." India beat defending champions Indonesia 3-0 in final.

363.title: Sri Lanka probes Indian media report of potential LTTE attack
363.article_body: Sri Lanka on Sunday said that it has launched an investigation into the claim of an Indian media report of a potential LTTE attack. Citing Indian intelligence sources, The Hindu had reported that some erstwhile cadre had entered Tamil Nadu to plan and execute attacks in Sri Lanka. The country also said that it's taking further steps to strengthen security.

364.title: Apna time aa gaya: Mahindra on India's 1st-ever Thomas Cup win for badminton
364.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra on Sunday reacted to India's first-ever Thomas Cup win for badminton by saying, "This is the dawn of an era of Indian ascendancy in this sport." He said, "I grew up reading about the Thomas Cup and titans like Indonesia's Rudy Hartono who dominated it. Today we swept Indonesia away...Apna time aa gaya (our time has come)."

365.title: 3 passengers dead, 10 injured as bus hits truck on highway in Gujarat
365.article_body: A private bus carrying over 30 passengers crashed into a parked truck on the Ahmedabad-Palanpur highway in Gujarat on Sunday, killing three people and injuring 10 others. The deceased, who were in their thirties, were from Rajasthan. The injured persons have been admitted to a civil hospital in Palanpur.

366.title: What are stablecoins, the product that led to a massive selloff in crypto market?
366.article_body: Stablecoin is a utility token built upon another coin's blockchain to create a cryptocurrency that's non-volatile, by maintaining its value at $1. However, stablecoin TerraUSD/'UST' collapsed from $1 to as low as 13 cents this week. Terra's token LUNA, meant to stabilise UST prices, fell 100% to a fraction of a cent, causing a massive selloff in crypto market.

367.title: Rahul is going for the kill, learning well from LSG mentor Gambhir: Piyush
367.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Piyush Chawla has praised KL Rahul, saying he's leading IPL debutants LSG brilliantly in the ongoing tournament. He added that LSG captain is learning well from the team's mentor Gautam Gambhir, who helped KKR win two titles under his captaincy. "It's good to see him going for the kill," he further said. LSG are currently second in standings.

368.title: Bollywood star kids look weird like boiled eggs: Kangana Ranaut
368.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut, when asked why South films are doing better than Bollywood films nowadays, said, "The way [the South industry] has a connect with their audience, it's very strong." She added that connect lacks in Bollywood as star kids "go abroad to complete their studies...talk in English...watch only Hollywood films." "They even look weird like boiled eggs," she added.

369.title: Delhi maximum temperature crosses 49 degrees amid heatwave warnings
369.article_body: Maximum temperatures breached the 49 degrees Celsius mark at two weather observatories in Delhi on Sunday, amid warnings of an intense heatwave in the national capital. Mungeshpur and Najafgarh observatories recorded 49.2 degrees Celsius and 49.1 degrees Celsius respectively. Gurugram, meanwhile, recorded a maximum temperature of 48.1 degrees Celsius. IMD has issued an orange alert for Delhi.

370.title: GT defeat CSK, become first team to win 10 matches in IPL 2022
370.article_body: GT defeated CSK by seven wickets in their IPL 2022 clash on Sunday. With the win, GT became the first team to win 10 matches in IPL 2022. GT are on top of the table with 20 points. They have been assured of a top-two finish on the points table. Wriddhiman Saha top-scored for GT with 67*(57).

371.title: RR to bat first against LSG in their IPL 2022 clash, playing XIs announced
371.article_body: RR captain Sanju Samson won the toss and elected to bat first in their IPL 2022 clash against LSG. RR have made two changes to their playing XI, with Jimmy Neesham and Obed McCoy replacing Rassie van der Dussen and Kuldeep Sen, respectively. Meanwhile, Ravi Bishnoi has replaced Karan Sharma in LSG's playing XI.

372.title: India will have no farmers in next 25 years: Sadhguru
372.article_body: Sadhguru has said that in another 25 years, India won't have any farmers because of the education system, which makes it mandatory for students to attend school till they are 18. He added that "out of the 63% of the farmers' population, not even 2% of farmers want their children to become the same".

373.title: Mumbai businessman's body recovered from creek in Thane
373.article_body: The body of a Mumbai-based businessman was recovered from a creek in Thane on Sunday morning, the police said. Some passers-by had alerted the police after spotting the body of 54-year-old Prashant Tukaram Vichare. As of now, the police have registered a case of accidental death and further investigation is on, an official said.

374.title: 11-yr-old boy cries before Bihar CM & says 'I want good education'; video viral
374.article_body: A video showing an 11-year-old class 6 student crying before Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and seeking his help to get a quality education has gone viral. Sonu Kumar told the CM, "Whatever my father earns he squanders on liquor", adding that he wants to be IAS/IPS if the government helped him. The CM has reportedly instructed officials to help him.

375.title: Great learning: David Hussey on Rahane batting vs SRH despite injury
375.article_body: KKR mentor David Hussey praised batter Ajinkya Rahane for batting against SunRisers Hyderabad despite his injury. In a video posted by KKR's Twitter handle, David said, "Great learning for everybody, if you are injured, don't come back, just start swinging out there and try to get as many as possible." Rahane scored 24-ball 28 runs against SRH.

376.title: NHRC seeks report from Delhi govt over Mundka fire that killed 27
376.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) on Sunday expressed serious concern over the fire incident at a four-storey building in Mundka that claimed 27 lives. It has asked the Delhi government to submit an action taken report to the commission within two weeks. NHRC also asked its Director General to send a team immediately to conduct an on spot investigation.

377.title: Symonds was a lovely guy, incredible human being & a fighter: Nikhil
377.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Nikhil Chopra said that late cricketer Andrew Symonds was a "lovely guy, full of life, helpful, and incredible human being." Recalling Symonds' playing days, Nikhil called the Australian a "fighter". "On many occasions, the team is on the verge of losing, he did a turnaround for them, which shows his mental toughness, and was a fighter," he said.

378.title: Putin's forces won't have a chance: 22-yr-old Olympic shooter defending Ukraine
378.article_body: Ukraine's 22-year-old shooter Kristina Dmitrenko, who won the gold medal in the 2016 Youth Olympic Games biathlon, is serving her nation with the National Guard of Ukraine amid the Russia-Ukraine war. She warned Russian President Vladimir Putin's forces that they won't have a chance, while adding, "I shoot well." "I'll stand to the end...victory will surely be ours," she added.

379.title: Such an electrifying personality: Pietersen on GT pacer Rashid Khan
379.article_body: Praising Rashid Khan, ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen said the GT pacer is an "electrifying personality", adding he's one of the "cool dudes" in the ongoing IPL. "He delivers whenever the captain looks at him. He's just in the feel in this season," he added. The 23-year-old has taken 16 wickets from 13 matches so far.

380.title: Man caught & beaten for raping 2 minor sisters in Gurugram
380.article_body: Two young sisters, both below five years of age, were allegedly raped by a 25-year-old man in Gurugram, police said on Saturday. The accused took the girls to his house on the pretext of giving them candy, police said. The girls' mother, however, caught him in the act, following which he was beaten before being handed over to the police.

381.title: Shuttler Chirag Shetty's shirtless celebration during Thomas Cup final goes viral
381.article_body: Indian shuttler Chirag Shetty's shirtless celebration during Thomas Cup final against Indonesia has gone viral. Shetty was seen removing his shirt and throwing it towards the crowd after winning his doubles match. India defeated Indonesia 3-0 in the final to win Thomas Cup for the first time in their history.

382.title: UP Police demoralised: Akhilesh criticises CM Yogi for DGP removal
382.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav criticised Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath for removing DGP Mukul Goel for inaction and said that the police force is demoralised. He also termed Adityanath's reasons for removing Goel as "childish". "Was his eligibility not checked at the time of his appointment? So those who selected him were also guilty," Yadav tweeted.

383.title: Pimpri-Chinchwad wards' boundaries final, no more changes now: PCMC
383.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation's election office said that there will be no more changes to the ward demarcation even if citizens make any suggestions or take objections. The demarcation was published on the PCMC website two days ago. The delimitation plan includes approval to changes in boundaries of Charholi, Bhosari, Chikhali, Indrayani Nagar and Premlok Park panels or wards.

384.title: Delhi CM to meet AAP MLAs tomorrow over anti-encroachment drives
384.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal will chair a meeting with all the MLAs of the Aam Aadmi Party on the ongoing anti-encroachment drives in Delhi on Monday. The meeting was scheduled to take place on May 14, but it was cancelled after a massive fire broke out in Mundka. The civic bodies have been carrying out anti-encroachment drives in multiple areas.

385.title: Man gets 1-yr rigorous imprisonment for flashing girl in Mumbai
385.article_body: A taxi driver was sentenced to one year of rigorous imprisonment by a special POCSO court for flashing his private parts at a 15-year-old female passenger at Mumbai's Charni Road in 2016. Notably, the man had claimed that he was being falsely implicated in the case over a dispute over the fare. However, the court rejected the man's claim.

386.title: I'm more than a rat in a rat race: Anushka on stepping away from her production house
386.article_body: Talking about stepping away from her production house, Anushka Sharma said, "My industry is all about...'run, run, run'...It's a rat race...you simply have to be part of it. But I'm more than a rat in a rat race." She added, "I want to enjoy...life...I never want to give [acting] up...That's why I had to make a sacrifice."

387.title: Finland will apply to join NATO ending decades of neutrality amid Russia-Ukraine war
387.article_body: Finland will apply to join the 30-member military alliance NATO amid the Russia-Ukraine war, the country's leaders announced on Sunday. This marks a historic shift in Finland's policy of neutrality that it adopted during the Cold War. Finnish President Sauli Niinisto called Russian President Vladimir Putin yesterday to tell him about the same and was told it would hurt ties.

388.title: If Roy shook your hand, you had his word: Ricky Ponting on Andrew Symonds
388.article_body: Condoling former Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds' demise, ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting tweeted, "If Roy shook your hand, you had his word, that's the sort of bloke he was and that's why I always wanted him on my team." Ponting added, "An extraordinary player and even better human being. Can't believe he's gone. Thoughts are with his family at this time."

389.title: Govt extends wheat procurement season till May 31, 2022
389.article_body: The government on Sunday announced that the wheat procurement season has been extended till May 31, 2022. "Present geopolitical situation and market prices may also affect the projected procurement of wheat during the current Rabi marketing season 2022-23 under the central pool," a government order said. Union Minister Piyush Goyal said it will "ensure that no wheat farmer faces inconvenience".

390.title: Mr Coach, you made us proud: Taapsee to boyfriend after India's Thomas Cup win
390.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu praised her boyfriend-coach Mathias Boe after the Indian men's badminton team created history by winning the Thomas Cup for the first time ever. Pannu took to her Instagram Stories and wrote, "Mr Coach, you made us proud," for Mathias Boe, India men's badminton team doubles coach. "What a performance, what a team," Boe wrote on Instagram.

391.title: ₹1 cr reward announced for men's badminton team for historic Thomas Cup win
391.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur has said that a ₹1 crore cash reward will be given to the Indian men's badminton team to acknowledge their historic Thomas Cup win. "This extraordinary feat, with successive victories over Malaysia, Denmark and Indonesia, calls for matching honour by the nation," said Thakur. PM Narendra Modi also congratulated the team.

392.title: World no. 8 Berrettini withdraws from 2022 French Open
392.article_body: World number eight Matteo Berrettini has pulled out from the French Open, beginning May 22, as he continues his recovery from a right hand injury, the Italian announced on Instagram on Saturday. "My hand is feeling great and I am working hard to build up my match fitness," he added. Berrettini had the surgery in March.

393.title: AC local train services to be increased to 32 in Mumbai from Monday
393.article_body: The number of air-conditioned local train services will be increased from 20 to 32 in the Mumbai suburban section from Monday onwards. The decision has been taken to meet the demands of the passengers travelling by AC locals, officials said. "Out of the additional 12 services being introduced, six services each will be in up and down directions," officials said.

394.title: Gang that arranged fake witnesses for bail busted in Faridabad
394.article_body: Faridabad Police on Saturday claimed to have busted a gang, headed by an advocate, that arranged fake witnesses for obtaining bail, but the advocate is yet to be arrested, they added. "The advocate used to produce fake witnesses after arranging fake personal IDs depending on the facts of bail matters," said DCP (crime) Faridabad Narender Kadiyan.

395.title: N Korea reports 8 lakh COVID-19 cases within 3 days of reporting 1st outbreak
395.article_body: North Korea on Sunday said it has 8,20,620 COVID-19 cases, three days after announcing the first cases of the infection on May 12. A total of 42 people have died of COVID-19 in North Korea, while 3,24,550 others are under medical treatment, state media KCNA said. The country is taking "swift state emergency measures" to control the epidemic, KCNA said.

396.title: Pooja awarded by PETA, 1st Indian director not to use animals in films
396.article_body: Actress-filmmaker Pooja Bhatt on Sunday took to Twitter to share a letter from PETA which awarded her PETA India's Compassionate Film Production Company Award. She has become the first Indian director to pledge not to use animals in her films. Pooja tweeted, "Will rely on computer graphics if a film/show of mine ever has an animal written into it."

397.title: I've been feeling bad since his exit: Sehwag on CSK's Jadeja
397.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja, Virender Sehwag said he's been feeling bad since CSK all-rounder's exit from the remainder of IPL 2022 due to a rib injury. Jadeja, who had captained the team in the first eight matches, played a total of 10 matches before being ruled out of the tournament. The 33-year-old hit 116 runs and took five wickets.

398.title: Told Thiago, 'I'd have signed you 4 yrs ago': Klopp after FA Cup win
398.article_body: After Liverpool won the FA Cup after beating Chelsea, Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said he had a conversation with Thiago Alcantara. "After the game, I said to Thiago, 'If I'd known what a player you are, I would have signed you four years earlier'," he joked. "Obviously, he could already play football...well, but he learned running at Liverpool," he added.

399.title: Andrew Symonds was a personality in Australian cricket: Madan Lal
399.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Madan Lal said he's "very sad" after hearing the news of Andrew Symonds' death. "Symonds was a personality in Australian cricket. Whatever cricket he played he played with a lot of passion," he added. "It is very sad, first Rodney Marsh then Shane Warne and now Andrew Symonds. I can only say rest in peace," he further said.

400.title: NCB seizes weed worth ₹1.5 cr at Foreign Post Office in Mumbai
400.article_body: Hydroponic weed valued at ₹1.5 crore was seized by the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) during two separate operations at the Foreign Post Office (FPO) in South Mumbai, an official said on Saturday. Around 1.7 kilograms of weed was seized during the operations. The operations were conducted on the basis of specific inputs that the drug was couriered from the US.

401.title: Man dies after coming in contact with illegally drawn live wire in B'luru
401.article_body: A 30-year-old man died after coming into contact with live wire that was illegally drawn to an advertisement hoarding near Hebbal police station bus stand in Bengaluru on Saturday. Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Ltd (BESCOM) officials said incident occurred after victim touched the metal portion of a bus shelter. Victim's body was shifted to B R Ambedkar Medical College Hospital.
